data.name: Blue Cipher Ring
data.description: Item for online play. Puts the wearer in ready state to answer should someone in another world call for rescue. You will be summoned to their world as a hunter. When summoned to rescue another player, your objective will be to defeat the invader.
data.effect: Enables the wearer to answer calls for rescue

data.name: White Cipher Ring
data.description: Item for online play. Allows you to automatically request for a hunter from another world to come to your rescue when your world is invaded. (You may be unable to summon rescuers under certain circumstances). A lost mystic code, enchanted to take the form of a ring. One of the fetishes said to have been bestowed by the Two Fingers.
data.effect: When invaded, request the aid of a hunter.

data.name: Furlcalling Finger Remedy
data.description: Item for online play. Craftable item. Reveals cooperative and competitive multiplayer signs. Co-op summoning signs will be shown in gold, while hostile summoning signs will be shown in red. Multiplayer begins when you summon a player from another world through their sign.
data.effect: Reveals co-op and hostile summoning signs

data.name: Tarnished's Furled Finger
data.description: Item for online play. Creates a summon sign for cooperative multiplayer. Your objective will be to defeat the area boss of the world to which you were summoned. A finger of corpse wax, furled like a hook. It is a relic of those who came before, left to help those who would come after.

data.name: Finger Severer
data.description: Item for online play.

data.name: Duelist's Furled Finger
data.description: Item for online play. Creates a summon sign for competitive multiplayer. Your objective will be to defeat the Host of Fingers of the world to which you were summoned. A finger of corpse wax, furled like a hook. The bronze adornments are the mark of a duelist.

data.name: Memory Of Grace
data.description: A phantom vision of the first grace, which once guided the Tarnished to the Lands Between. Lose all runes and return to last site of grace at which you rested. It all repeats. Be seen by the Elden Ring. Become the Elden Lord.
data.effect: Lose all runes, return to last site of lost grace.

data.name: Tarnished's Wizened Finger
data.description: Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Messages menu.) Use to write messages. Your messages will be conveyed to other worlds, allowing other players to read them. A finger of corpse wax, so emaciated the bone is visible. It is a relic of those who came before, left to help those who would come after.

data.name: Taunter's Tongue
data.description: Item for online play. Lures in invaders. This allows your world to be invaded without any Furled Finger cooperators present, and it also shortens the interval between windows of opportunity for invasion. Additionally, enables the arrival of a second invader. (When two invaders are present, you will be limited to one cooperator.)

data.name: Bloody Finger
data.description: Item for online play. Attempts an invasion of another player's world. If successful, your objective will be to defeat the Host of Fingers of the world to which you were summoned. The nail of this finger is shot through with streaks of fresh, glistening blood. The finger's sickly pale skin feels nothing now, but the nail still aches with sweetest pain.
data.effect: Attempts invasion of other player's world.

data.name: Small Golden Effigy
data.description: Online multiplayer item. Sends a summon sign for cooperative multiplayer to a nearby summoning pool. In cooperative multiplayer, you will be summoned to another world to help defeat the area boss.
data.effect: Send co-operative sign to summoning pool

data.name: Small Red Effigy
data.description: Item for online play. Sends a competitive sign to a nearby summoning pool. In competitive multiplayer, your objective will be to defeat the Host of Fingers of the world to which you were summoned.
data.effect: Sends competitive sign to summoning pool

data.name: Festering Bloody Finger
data.description: Item for online play.
data.effect: Attempts invasion of other player's world

data.name: Flask Of Crimson Tears
data.description: A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of life. Filled with crimson tears, this flask restores HP with use. Rest at a site of grace to replenish. It is said that a Finger Maiden will bestow two such chalices upon the chosen Tarnished when they meet.

data.name: Flask Of Cerulean Tears
data.description: A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of life. Filled with cerulean tears, this flask restores FP with use. Rest at a site of grace to replenish. It is said that a Finger Maiden will bestow two such chalices upon the chosen Tarnished when they meet.

data.name: Scriptstone
data.description: Ruin fragment inscribed with letters.  Craftable item. Reveals additional messages from other worlds. Words are gregarious things, drawn to one another much as people are.
data.effect: Reveals more messages from other worlds

data.name: Holy Water Pot
data.description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. Enchanted by incantations of the Golden Order.
data.effect: Uses FP. Throw at enemies to inflict holy damage

data.name: Rainbow Stone
data.description: Ruin Fragment that has undergone some simple processing.
data.effect: Shines with colored light when placed, serving as a guide

data.name: Roped Fire Pot
data.description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot.
data.effect: Throw behind to inflict fire damage.

data.name: Rowa Raisin
data.description: Preparation of dried Rowa fruit.
data.effect: On horseback, feed to spectral steed to restore HP

data.name: Glowstone
data.description: Polished Ruin Fragment that shines brighter than a Rainbow Stone. Craftable item. Emits light from the location it is placed, illuminating surroundings. However, the effect is short-lived, and it lacks the diverse colors of rainbow stones. May serve some benefit in dark places, or at night.
data.effect: Emits a faint light from the location it is placed

data.name: Pauper's Rune
data.description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of The Lands Between; the lingering residue of gold. Use to gain a few runes. For all that they may be feeble things, these runes will act as nourishment for the development of any Tarnished. Provided a Finger Maiden can be found...
data.effect: Use to gain a few runes

data.name: Flask Of Wondrous Physick
data.description: A relic of the physick chemists, priests of the Erdtree. Harnesses the powers of crystal tears, which only form after the passage of many moons. Various specials effects are bestowed upon the drinker, dependent on the specific mixture of crystal tears. Rest at a site of grace to replenish. It is said that in the Lands Between, pools of crystal tears amass at the bases of Minor Erdtrees.

data.name: Immunizing Cured Meat
data.description: Cured strip of meat, dried out after pickling in a green medicinal solution. Craftable item. Temporarily boosts immunity Higher immunity helps to mitigate the buildup of various poisons and scarlet rot

data.name: Pickled Turtle Neck
data.description: Turtle neck meat, pickled in a bitter medicinal solution.

data.name: Fireproof Dried Liver
data.description: Cured animal liver, dried out after pickling in a flame-hued medical solution. Craftable item. Boosts fire damage negation for a short time, improving damage mitigation against attacks imbued with fire.
data.effect: Boosts  Fire Damage Negation for a short time.

data.name: Drawstring Fire Grease
data.description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of incendiary materials. Craftable item. A smallish lump with a short string attached. Quickly coats armament, inflicting fire damage. However, the effects are only brief.
data.effect: Quickly coats weapon, inflicting  Fire Damage

data.name: Fire Pot
data.description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of incendiary materials is sealed inside.
data.effect: Throw at enemies to inflict Fire Damage

data.name: Fire Grease
data.description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of incendiary materials. Craftable item. Coats armament, adding fire damage to attacks. The effect last only for a short time.

data.name: Neutralizing Boluses
data.description: Green boluses made from cave moss. Craftable item. Alleviates poison buildup and cures poison ailment. Poison accumulates gradually, coming into effect once the threshold is reached. Poison ailment lowers HP in steady increments for a period.
data.effect: Alleviates poison buildup and cures poison

data.name: Exalted Flesh
data.description: A lump of animal pickled in a medicinal solution mixed with fiery spices. Craftable item. Temporarily Boosts physical attack Considered a delicacy in the badlands, this invigorating repast was for the exclusive benefit of those who they called heroes.

data.name: Sleep Pot
data.description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. Filled with the incantations of St. Trina. Consumes FP. Throw at enemy to release a purple, soporific haze. Like a lullaby, or a quagmire, it irresistibly draws its victims down into sleep. Sweet dreams.

data.name: Gold-pickled Fowl Foot
data.description: Four-toed foot of a fowl, pickled in a golden medicinal solution. Craftable item. Boosts the amount of runes obtained from defeating enemies for a certain duration Since old times, the needy would scrape the meat clean even from a fowl's claw.
data.effect: Boosts rune acquisition for a time (30%)

data.name: Dragon Heart
data.description: Dragon heart seized by a dragon tracker. It has a bizarre shape, mottled by gravel, and it continues to beat vivaciously. An offering used in the Dragon Communion. Consume a dragon's heart at the altar to make its power yours. While a terrible and savage-looking thing, the heart has a peculiar beauty to it.
data.effect: Gain power of the dragon at the Dragon Communion altar.

data.name: Throwing Dagger
data.description: Short dagger for throwing.
data.effect: Throw at enemies to inflict damage

data.name: Stimulating Boluses
data.description: Light-purple boluses made from cave moss. Craftable item. Alleviates buildup of sleep. Sleep accumulates gradually, causing sudden fogginess and loss of FP once the threshold is reached, even if it does not force the afflicted into true slumber. Take one of these into timely fashion to avoid such events.

data.name: Stanching Boluses
data.description: Red boluses made from cave moss Craftable item. Alleviates impending blood loss Blood loss escalates gradually, causing great damage once the threshold is reached. Take one of these in timely fashion to avoid such an event.

data.name: Lands Between Rune
data.description: Grace said to have once dwelled in the eyes of the inhabitants of the Lands Between; the lingering residue of gold.

data.name: Golden Seed
data.description: A golden seed, found at the base of an illusory tree.
data.effect: Increases Sacred Flask's number of uses

data.name: Bewitching Branch

data.effect: Uses FP to charm pierced enemy

data.name: Boiled Prawn

data.name: Furlcalling Finger Remedy
data.description: Item for online play. Craftable item. Reveals cooperative and competitive multiplayer signs. Co-op summoning signs will be shown in gold, while hostile summoning signs will be shown in red. Multiplayer begins when you summon a player from another world through their sign.
data.effect: Reveals co-op and hostile summoning signs

data.name: Roped Fetid Pot
data.description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of effluents is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot. Throw at rearward enemies to cause buildup of deadly poison. Beware though; those who carry these pots will slowly accumulate poison in their own bodies. Push someone in a privy; expect to get dung on your hands.
data.effect: Throw behind to cause buildup of deadly poison

data.name: Roped Poison Pot

data.name: Beastlure Pot
data.description: Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot. Enchanted with assassin incantations. Consumes FP. Throw to create a red shadow. The illusion lures in beasts into attacking it. This effect does not change even during combat.

data.name: Roped Oil Pot
data.description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of oil-infused materials is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot. Throw at rearward enemies to soak them in oil, making them heavily susceptible to fire damage.
data.effect: Throw behind to douse enemies in oil

data.name: Rancor Pot
data.description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. Enchanted by the ancient death hex. Consumes FP. Throw at enemies to spawn vengeful spirits that chase down foes. In times of old, the dead were burned with ghostflame, and from those cinders arose vengeful spirits.
data.effect: Uses FP. Throw to summon vengeful spirits.

data.name: Cursed-blood Pot
data.description: Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot. Decorated with the crest of the Lord of Blood. Throw at enemies to douse them in accursed blood, causing summoned spirits to assail them with a rabid fervor. A childhood memory of the Lord of Blood.
data.effect: Throw to douse enemy with accursed blood.

data.name: Freezing Pot

data.effect: Throw at enemies to cause buildup of frost.

data.name: Poison Pot
data.description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of poisonous materials is sealed inside. Throw at enemies to cause buildup of poison.

data.effect: Throw at enemies to soak them in oil.

data.name: Poison Spraymist
data.description: Forbidden art of depraved perfumers. Craftable with a perfume bottle. Uses FP to release a poison mist from user's mouth, causing a buildup of poison. Perfumed powder is held in the mouth to dissolve before being expelled. It was once a restorative art, or so it is said.
data.effect: Uses FP to release poison mist from the mouth.

data.name: Fetid Pot
data.description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of effluents is sealed inside. As the mixture ferments, toxins are produced alongside a putrid stench that seeps out once ripe. Throw at enemies to cause buildup of deadly poison. Beware though; those who carry these pots will slowly accumulate poison in their own bodies. Push someone in a privy; expect to get dung on your hands.
data.effect: Throw at enemies to cause deadly buildup of poison.

data.name: Giantsflame Fire Pot
data.description: Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot. Enchanted by incantations of the Giants' Flame. Consumes FP. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy fire damage. Damage scales with faith.
data.effect: Uses FP. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy fire damage.

data.name: Bloodboil Aromatic
data.description: Forbidden art of depraved perfumers. Craftable with a perfume bottle. Uses FP to enter a temporary state of fervor, raising maximum attack power and stamina while also increasing damage received. "Even upon the battlefield, do you fear being wounded? Take a good look. Your limbs are frozen stiff."
data.effect: Uses FP to enter a temporary state of fervor.

data.name: Margit's Shackle
data.description: A fetish bathed in golden magic. Shackles were used to bind the accursed people called the Omen, and these ones were made to keep a particular Omen under strictest confinement. Though faint, the shackles still retain vestiges of power — enough to trap the once-bound Margit on earth, if only for a short time.
data.effect: Binds Margit and Morgott two times per battle

data.name: Remembrance Of The Omen King
data.description: Remembrance of Morgott, the Omen King, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. Though born one of the graceless Omen, Morgott took it upon himself to become the Erdtree's protector. He loved not in return, for he was never loved, but nevertheless, love it he did.
data.effect: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader

data.description: Remembrance of Maliketh, the Black Blade, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. Maliketh was a shadowbound beast given to his Empyrean. Marika's sole need of her shadow was a vessel to lock away Destined Death. Even then, she betrayed him.

It's said a deathbed companion will only produce a blessing of this kind for a champion but once in her entire life. The sole blessing which she imbues of her own volition.
data.effect: Uses FP to temporarily raise poise

data.description: Leather bag containing a pestle and mortar, small blade, and various other tools. Enables item crafting from the main menu. Provides both means to fight and means to survive.

data.name: Telescope
data.description: Astrology tool used by members of the Carian royal family. Part of a larger instrument, removed and stolen away. Allows the viewer to better see faraway things. During the age of the Erdtree, Carian astrology withered on the vine. The fate once writ in the night skies had been fettered by the Golden Order.
data.effect: Allows viewer to see faraway things

data.effect: Summon and ride spectral steed Torrent.

data.description: Dragon heart seized by a dragon tracker. It has a bizarre shape, mottled by gravel, and it continues to beat vivaciously. An offering used in the Dragon Communion. Consume a dragon's heart at the altar to make its power yours. While a terrible and savage-looking thing, the heart has a peculiar beauty to it.
data.effect: Gain power of the dragon at the Dragon Communion altar.

data.name: Fingerprint Grape
data.description: Eyeball of the knight Vyke, inflamed yellow.
data.effect: Eyeball of the knight Vyke, inflamed yellow

data.name: Prattling Pate "hello"
data.description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head.

data.name: Prattling Pate "thank You"
data.description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head.
data.effect: Emits a voice that says "Thank you"

data.name: Prattling Pate "apologies"
data.description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head. Emits a voice that says "Apologies."

data.name: Wraith Calling Bell
data.description: Bell used by worshippers of revenants.
data.effect: Uses FP to ring bell and calls prowling wraiths

data.name: Larval Tear
data.description: Core of a creature of mimicry known as a silver tear.
data.effect: Material needed by Rennala to grant rebirth

data.name: Seluvis's Potion
data.description: Small flask received from Preceptor Seluvis containing a cloudy tonic of bluish black.
data.effect: Small flask received from Preceptor Seluvis

data.name: Mirage Riddle
data.description: A riddle concerning a rise that vanishes like a mirage.
data.effect: Simple map taken from an imp statue.

data.name: Valkyrie's Prosthesis
data.description: Golden prosthesis once used by the one-armed valkyrie. A masterwork of craftsmanship, with practice and skill it can be used as proficiently as a real arm. When Maleigh Marais, Lord of the Shaded Castle, embraced this prosthesis, he claimed to feel the presence of his personal goddess.
data.effect: Golden prosthesis used by the one-armed Valkyrie

data.name: Weathered Dagger
data.description: Dagger received from Fia, the Deathbed Companion.
data.effect: Dagger received from Fia, Deathbed Companion

data.name: Seluvis's Introduction
data.description: Scroll bearing a royal coat of arms.
data.effect: Letter of introduction addressed to Sellen

data.name: Lost Ashes Of War
data.description: Empty ashes of war, devoid of any memories of battle.

data.name: Fingerslayer Blade
data.description: The hidden treasure of the Eternal City of Nokron; a blade said to have been born of a corpse.
data.effect: Hidden treasure of the Eternal City of Nokron

data.name: Ancestral Infant's Head
data.description: Skull of a very young ancestral spirit. Just think how many sproutings It might bear.
data.effect: Uses FP to spray spirit vapor

data.name: Carian Inverted Statue
data.description: Statuette of a scholar, with ground and sky inverted.
data.effect: Key revealing the hidden form of Carian Study Hall

data.name: Cursemark Of Death
data.description: Cursemark carved into the discarded flesh of Ranni the Witch. Also known as the half-wheel wound of the centipede.
data.effect: Cursemark carved into Lunar Princess Ranni's discarded flesh

data.name: Rold Medallion
data.description: Conjoined split medallion depicting the Flame Peak. Brandishing the medallion activates the Grand Lift of Rold, connecting Leyndell to the Mountaintops of the Giants. The forge of the flame of ruin is said to be found upon their peaks, and it is here Melina wishes to travel in resuming your journey together.

data.name: Miniature Ranni
data.description: A doll resembling Ranni the Witch.

data.name: The Stormhawk King
data.description: Ashes of a hawk revered by all others as sovereign back in the days when Stormveil's winds still raged like no other. This ancient monarch is proud however, refusing to answer anyone's summons.
data.effect: Ashes of a hawk which heeds no summons.

data.name: Dark Moon Ring
data.description: Ring depicting a leaden full moon. Symbolic of a cold oath, the ring is supposed to be given by Lunar Princess Ranni to her consort.
data.effect: Ring of Lunar Princess Ranni's cold oath

data.name: Dectus Medallion (right)
data.description: Right half of a split medallion depicting the Erdtree.
data.effect: Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Dectus

data.name: Haligtree Secret Medallion (left)
data.description: Left half of a split medallion depicting the Haligtree. Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Rold, granting access to a hidden path. In other words, this secret medallion will guide the bearer to the land of Miquella's Haligtree.
data.effect: Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Rold

data.name: Haligtree Secret Medallion (right)
data.description: Right half of a split medallion depicting the Haligtree. Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Rold, granting access to a hidden path. In other words, this secret medallion will guide the bearer to the land of Miquella's Haligtree.
data.effect: Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Rold

data.name: Assassin's Prayerbook
data.description: Prayerbook of the Roundtable Hold's assassins.
data.effect: Give to a learned cleric to acquire new incantations

data.name: Dectus Medallion (left)
data.description: Left half of a split medallion depicting the Erdtree.
data.effect: Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Dectus

data.name: Fire Monks' Prayerbook
data.description: Prayerbook of the Fire Monks, who came from the Mountaintops of the Giants far to the north.
data.effect: Give to a learned cleric to acquire new incantations

data.name: Dragon Cult Prayerbook
data.description: Prayerbook of the capital's ancient dragon cult.
data.effect: Give to a learned cleric to acquire new incantations

data.name: Two Fingers Prayerbook
data.description: Prayerbook containing incantations of the Two Fingers. An item once entrusted to Tarnished worthy of lordship.
data.effect: Give to a learned cleric to acquire new incantations

data.name: Conspectus Scroll
data.effect: Give to Sorceress Sellen to unlock Glintstone Cometshard and Star Shower

data.name: Ancient Dragon Prayerbook
data.description: Prayerbook of the capital's ancient dragon cult. A lost tome that never reached the Lands Between.
data.effect: Give to a learned cleric to acquire new incantations

data.name: Royal House Scroll
data.description: Sorcery scroll of the Carian royal family, the heads of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
data.effect: Give to a learned sorcerer to acquire new sorceries

data.name: Academy Scroll
data.description: Scroll of the Academy of Raya Lucaria, the glintstone sorcerers' place of study.
data.effect: Give to a learned sorcerer to acquire new sorceries

data.name: Whetstone Knife
data.description: Whetstone with a cipher inscription, made to look like a small knifeblade.
data.effect: Can add new battle arts and affinities to weapons

data.name: Glintstone Whetblade
data.description: Glintstone whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife.
data.effect: Grants choice of affinity upgrade to weapon

data.name: Iron Whetblade
data.description: Iron whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife.
data.effect: Grants choice of affinity upgrade to weapon

data.name: Whetstone Knife
data.description: Whetstone with a cipher inscription, made to look like a small knifeblade.
data.effect: Can add new battle arts and affinities to weapons

data.name: Black Whetblade
data.description: Black whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife.
data.effect: Grants choice of affinity upgrade to weapon

data.name: Sancrified Whetblade
data.description: Sanctified whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife. When applying an affinity using physical or golden-type ashes of war, an additional affinity of sacred or lightning can be chosen.
data.effect: Grants choice of affinity upgrade to weapon.

data.name: Map (limgrave, West)
data.description: Map of the western region of Limgrave. The demesne of Limgrave, far south of the Erdtree, is bordered to the northwest by the cliffs of Stormveil, and under its ever-clouded skies roll the great steppes of the pale lands.

data.name: Map (limgrave, East)
data.description: Map of the eastern region of Limgrave.

data.name: Map (weeping Peninsula)
data.description: Map of the Weeping Peninsula.

data.name: Map (weeping Peninsula)
data.description: Map of the Weeping Peninsula.

data.name: Map (liurnia, East)
data.description: Map of Liurnia's eastern region.

data.name: Map (liurnia, North)
data.description: Map of Liurnia's northern region.

data.name: Map (dragonbarrow)
data.description: Map of Dragonbarrow and environs.
data.effect: Reveals the region of Dragonbarrow on the map.

data.name: Map (liurnia, West)
data.description: Map of Liurnia's western region.
data.effect: Reveals the western portion of Liurnia on your map.

data.name: Map (ainsel River)
data.description: Map of Ainsel River and environs
data.effect: Map of Ainsel River and environs

data.name: Map (siofra River)
data.description: Map of Siofra River and environs
data.effect: Reveals the region of Siofra River on the map.

data.name: Map (altus Plateau)
data.description: Map of Altus Plateau and environs. The Altus Plateau, where the Erdtree's base can be found, contains the Royal Capital of Leyndell to the east, and Mt. Gelmir to the west. Scars from the Shattering remain apparent to this day.
data.effect: Reveals  Altus Plateau on your map

data.name: Map (leyndell, Royal Capital)
data.description: Map of the Royal Capital of Leyndell and environs.
data.effect: Reveals the region of Leyndell on the map.

data.name: Map (caelid)
data.description: Map of Caelid and environs.
data.effect: Reveals the region of Caelid on the map.

data.name: Map (mountaintops Of The Giants, West)
data.description: Map of Western Mountaintops of the Giants. Marching ground during the War against the Giants. They carved winding paths in the cliff walls right up to the summit, leading to the untrodden snow-laden region beyond.
data.effect: Map of Western Mountaintops of the Giants.

data.name: Map (mountaintops Of The Giants, East)
data.description: Map of Eastern Mountaintops of the Giants. The remote, desolate eastern summit is the highest point in all the Lands Between, overlooking even the Flame Peak to the south.
data.effect: Map of Eastern Mountaintops of the Giants.

data.name: Map (consecrated Snowfield)
data.description: Map of Consecrated Snowfield and environs. The route through this land, crossed east to west by a frozen river, leads to Miquella's Haligtree. This is the path taken by those unchosen, though it is a trial all the same.
data.effect: Map of Consecrated Snowfield and environs.

data.name: Map (lake Of Rot)
data.description: Map of Lake of Rot and environs. A great lake of standing water downstream of the Ainsel River. It is said that the divine essence of an outer god is sealed away in this land.
data.effect: Map of Lake of Rot and environs.

data.name: Note (land Squirts)
data.description: A note sold by a nomadic merchant. Contains information about land squirts.

data.name: Map (deeproot Depths)
data.description: Map of Deeproot Depths and environs. At the very depths of the Erdtree's majestic roots lies the source of the Ainsel and the Siofra rivers. Here too begins the network of Greattree roots that spread throughout the Lands Between.
data.effect: Revels Deeproot Depths and environs on your map

data.name: Note (stonedigger Trolls)
data.description: A note sold by a nomadic merchant. Contains information about stonedigger trolls.

data.name: Note (flask Of Wondrous Physick)
data.description: A note sold by a nomadic merchant.

data.name: Note (waypoint Ruins)
data.description: A note sold by a nomadic merchant.

data.name: Ruptured Crystal Tear
data.description: A special crystallization formed within a tear of life over the course of many moons. Causes concoction to explode when taken in mixed physick. A dangerous form of crystal tear which possesses absolutely no medicinal qualities. A lesson said to be learned the hard way for some; faith can be a volatile matter, after all.
data.effect: Causes concoction to explode in mixed physick

data.name: Greenspill Crystal Tear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
data.effect: Temporarily boosts stamina in mixed physick

data.name: Cerulean Crystal Tear
data.description: A special crystallization formed over the course of many moons within a tear of life, a blessing of the Erdtree. Can be mixed in a flask of wondrous physick. The resulting concoction restores 20 half of one's max FP.
data.effect: Restores half of total FP in mixed physick.

data.name: Cerulean Hidden Tear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
data.effect: Eliminates all FP consumption in mixed physick

data.name: Crimson Crystal Tear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction restores half of one's maximum HP.
data.effect: Restores half of total HP in mixed physick

data.name: Crimsonburst Crystal Tear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's
data.effect: Steadily restores HP for a time in mixed physick

data.name: Faith-knot Crystal Tear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily boosts one's faith.
data.effect: Temporarily boosts faith in mixed physick

data.name: Strength-knot Crystal Tear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
data.effect: Temporarily boosts strength in mixed physick

data.name: Opaline Bubbletear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
data.effect: Significantly negates damage in mixed physick

data.name: Spiked Cracked Tear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
data.effect: Enhances charged attacks for a time in mixed physick

data.name: Dexterity-knot Crystal Tear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
data.effect: Temporarily boosts dexterity in mixed physick

data.name: Lightning-shrouding Cracked Tear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
data.effect: Temporarily boosts lightning attacks in mixed physick

data.name: Magic-shrouding Cracked Tear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
data.effect: Temporarily boosts magic attacks in mixed physick

data.name: Winged Crystal Tear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
data.effect: Temporarily reduces equip load in mixed physick

data.name: Holy-shrouding Cracked Tear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
data.effect: Temporarily boosts holy attacks in mixed physick

data.name: Twiggy Cracked Tear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
data.effect: Briefly stop rune loss on death in mixed physick

data.name: Leaden Hardtear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
data.effect: Temporarily boosts poise in mixed physick

data.name: Crimsonspill Crystal Tear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily raises one's maximum HP.
data.effect: Temporarily boosts max HP in mixed physick

data.name: Greenburst Crystal Tear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction gradually restores stamina recovery speed.
data.effect: Temporarily boosts stamina recovery speed in mixed physick.

data.name: Speckled Hardtear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily raises all resistances and heals all status ailments.
data.effect: Boosts resistance and heals status in mixed physick.

data.name: Flame-shrouding Cracked Tear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily boosts the power of one's fire attacks.
data.effect: Temporarily boosts the power of one's fire attacks.

data.name: Crimson Bubbletear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction automatically heals one's HP in the moment before death. However, this effect only occurs once, and will expire after a certain duration.
data.effect: Restores HP when near death in mixed physick.

data.name: Crimsonwhorl Bubbletear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction converts incoming damage into recovered HP instead. However, physical damage cannot be converted. This effect is only brief and will quickly expire.
data.effect: Converts damage received into HP in mixed physick.

data.name: Thorny Cracked Tear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction makes consecutive attacks grow stronger the longer they continue. However, the effect lasts only for a short time.
data.effect: Makes consecutive attacks grow stronger in mixed physick.

data.name: Stonebarb Cracked Tear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
data.effect: Make attacks more likely to break enemy stances in a mixed physick

data.name: Windy Crystal Tear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction increases the effectiveness of dodgerolls for a certain duration. However, damage taken is also increased during the concoction's effect.
data.effect: Enhances dodge rolls for a time in mixed physick

data.name: Opaline Hardtear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily boosts all forms of damage negation.
data.effect: Temporarily boosts all damage negations in physick

data.name: Purifying Crystal Tear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the age where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wonderous Physick. The resulting conction purifies the curse from Mohg, Lord of Blood's terrifying rite of blood.
data.effect: Purifies the Lord of Blood's curse in a mixed physick

data.name: Aeonian Butterfly
data.description: A butterfly with withered, scarlet wings found in the swamp of Aeonia. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Albinauric Bloodclot
data.description: The thick, coagulated blood of the Ablinaurics. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Intelligence-knot Crystal Tear
data.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
data.effect: Temporarily boosts intelligence in mixed physick.

data.name: Altus Bloom
data.description: A golden-tingerd flower from a succulent plant that blooms on the Altus Plateau. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Arteria Leaf
data.description: Dark red leaves with thick, swollen veins. Material used for crafting items. Exceedingly rare to find. A faint pulse can be felt in the veins. Stirs the blood, providing an enlivening effect.

data.name: Beast Liver
data.description: The fresh liver of a beast; a luscious fruit of life. Material used for crating items. Found by hunting herbivorous beast. Dried liver boost damage negation.

data.name: Beast Blood
data.description: Fresh beast blood, glinting with gold. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Bloodrose
data.description: Blood-slick roses that bloom in festering blood. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Blood-tainted Excrement
data.description: The bloody excrement of a carnivorous beast. Material used for crafting items. Found in the land of the new dynasty. Mixed inside with half-digested flesh are dense colonies of tiny eggs of unknown but assuredly revolting origin.

data.name: Budding Cave Moss
data.description: Faintly luminescent moss that grows in dark caves, speckled with tiny, yellow flowers. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Cave Moss
data.description: Faintly luminescent moss that grows in dark caves. Material used in crafting items. A fundamental ingredient for medicinal boluses.
data.obtainedFrom: Gives off pale light in dark caverns.

data.name: Cracked Crystal
data.description: A cracked, impure, degraded, and altogether unremarkable crystal. Material used for crafting items

data.name: Crystal Cave Moss
data.description: Faintly luminescent moss that grows in dark caves, laced with fine crystals. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Budding Horn
data.description: A rarely-seen specimen of a young, budding horn. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting herbivorous beasts.

data.name: Crab Eggs
data.description: Eggs of lare crabs which dwell in the shallows. Materials used for crafting items.

data.name: Cracked Pot
data.description: This empty pot somehow mends itself when broken.
data.effect: Container required for crafting cracked pot items

data.name: Ritual Pot
data.description: This empty pot somehow mends itself when broken. Special item with greater durability than a cracked pot.
data.effect: Container required for crafting ritual pot items

data.name: Crystal Bud
data.description: A young plant, crystalized before it could mature. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Dewkissed Herba
data.description: A herb that grows in the false night in and around the Eternal City. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Eye Of Yelough
data.description: A shrub fruit bursting with ripened pulp. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Erdleaf Flower
data.description: A dusky-yellow flower that has started to fade and wilt. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Faded Erdleaf Flower
data.description: An Erdleaf flower that has faded into a plate scarlet, found blooming in rotten lands. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Fire Blossom
data.description: A half-ashen and smoldering flower that blooms on the mountaintops of the Giants. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Flight Pinion
data.description: Flight feather of a bird of prey. Material used for crafting items. Commonly used for arrow fletchings.

data.name: Formic Rock
data.description: Rock formed from solidified giant ant venom. Highly acidic. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Four-toed Fowl Foot
data.description: Foot of a four-toed fowl. Material used for crafting items. In the Lands Between, having three digits is seen as a bad omen. As such, the rarer four-toed fowl's is a gift of great luck indeed.

data.name: Fulgurbloom
data.description: Yellow flower that grows in lightning-struck lands. Material used for crafting items. Imbued with traces of lightning's essence.

data.name: Glintstone Firefly
data.description: A firefly whose glowing tail has hardened into glintstone, widely found in Liurnia Lake. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Glintstone Scrap
data.description: Piece of glintstone tinged with unstable magic. Found in crystal tunnels. Break gem, using FP to produce a magic bolt. Poor quality and thereby easily broken, a sorcerer wouldn't give it a second look.
data.effect: Break gem, using FP to produce a magic bolt.

data.name: Gold Firefly
data.description: Firefly that gives off a golden light. Material used in crafting items. Found near bodies of water close to Minor Erdtrees. The light of fireflies is believed to have an alluring magic. Golden light is considered to invite runes.

data.name: Gold-tinged Excrement
data.description: Someone's excrement. It has a golden tinge. Material used for crafting items. Often hidden in woods and thickets. Gold-tinged excrement is a highly stable substance; it doesn't dry out, nor does it lose its customary warmth or scent. For better or for worse, it remains as it is.
data.obtainedFrom: Often hidden in woods and thickets.

data.name: Golden Centipede
data.description: The golden, desiccated remains of a centipede.

data.name: Golden Dung
data.description: Someone's excrement. It has a golden tinge. Material used for crafting items. Gold-tinged excrement is a highly stable substance; it doesn't dry out, nor does it lose its customary warmth or scent. For better or for worse, it remains as it is.

data.name: Golden Rowa
data.description: A Rowa fruit tinted with gold. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Golden Sunflower
data.description: A golden sunflower that grows facing the Erdtree. Material used for crafting items. Found near Minor Erdtrees.

data.name: Grave Violet
data.description: A purple flower than blooms in graveyards. Material used for crafting items.
data.obtainedFrom: At Liurnia of The Lakes' graves.

data.name: Gravel Stone
data.description: A small clump of sharp, pointed stones. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Great Dragonfly Head
data.description: Head of a large dragonfly. Material used for crafting items. Long believed to have the ability to neutralize poisons.

data.name: Herba
data.description: Evergreen leaves that give off a faith light. Material used for crafting items. This very common medicinal plant can be found in thickets and elsewhere.

data.name: Hidden Plumage
data.description: Rarely-seen dark plumage found inside the wing. Material used for crafting items. Death's bearers were once said to have taken the form of birds, symbolized by these black feathers.

data.name: Human Bone Shard
data.description: Fragment of bone with dun mottling. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting Those Who Live in Death.

data.name: Living Jar Shard
data.description: A fragment of a living jar, hardened after its death. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Lump Of Flesh
data.description: A lump of beast flesh filled with rich juices. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting carnivorous beast. Meat suitable for a rustic feast.

data.name: Land Octopus Ovary
data.description: Puffy, milky white ovary of a land octopus. Material used for crafting items. Land octopuses eat humans in order to bear young, and theirs is the blood that runs through these ovaries.

data.name: Melted Mushroom
data.description: A mushroom that grows in the false night in and around the Eternal City. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Miquella's Lily
data.description: A delicate water lily of unalloyed gold that has started to fade and wilt. Material used for crafting items. Exeedingly rare to find.

data.name: Miranda Powder
data.description: Pollen from a man-eating miranda flower. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Moon Egg
data.description: Owl eggs that will never hatch. Material used for crafting items. Prized as a symbol of the most sublime slumber.

data.name: Old Fang
data.description: A rarely-seen specimen of beast fang.

data.name: Mushroom
data.description: A fungal growth that thrives in damp thickets and elsewhere. Material used for crafting items. Its thick, spongy flesh makes it a key component in throwing pots.
data.obtainedFrom: Thrives in damp thickets and elsewhere.

data.name: Perfume Bottle
data.description: Glass bottles used by perfumers. Used to seal various scent compounds.
data.effect: Container required for crafting perfume items

data.name: Poisonbloom
data.description: Flower that grows in toxic terrain. Material used for crafting items. Poisonous, but may also provide the cure.

data.name: Nascent Butterfly
data.description: An arcane butterfly with translucent wings. Material used for crafting items. Exceedingly rare to find.

data.name: Rimed Crystal Bud
data.description: A young plant, frozen into a crystal before it could mature. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Rimed Rowa
data.description: A berry-like fruit, thought to be the original strain of Rowa. Material used for crafting items. Found in frigid highlands.

data.name: Root Resin
data.description: Resin secreted from the roots of the Great tree. Material used in crafting items. The roots of the Great tree drive far and wide through the earth of the Lands Between. They were once entwined with the roots of the Erdtree, or so they say.
data.obtainedFrom: Secreted from the roots of the Greattree. Can also be found near trees on the surface.

data.name: Rowa Fruit
data.description: Berry-like red fruits that grow in shrubs. Material used for crafting items. Easily found everywhere in the Lands Between, it is primarily used in preserved foods.
data.obtainedFrom: Easily found everywhere in the Lands Between.

data.name: Ruin Fragment
data.description: Stone fragment found near places where ruins have fallen from the sky. Can be used for crafting, or simply for throwing at enemies. These shards of stone are believed to have once been part of a temple in the sky. They glow with a faint light from within.

data.name: Sacramental Bud
data.description: An immature bud containing fresh blood. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Sanctuary Stone
data.description: A rare piece of stone fragment found near places where ruins have fallen from the sky. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Slumbering Egg
data.description: Owl eggs that will never hatch. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Smoldering Butterfly
data.description: An eternally burning butterfly found near wildfires and elsewhere. Material used for crafting items. Serves as the kindling for a number of items.

data.name: String
data.description: Boasting no special qualities, this is merely a goodly length of string.

data.name: Silver Firefly
data.description: Firefly that gives off a silvery light. Material used in crafting items. Found near bodies of cold water untouched by sunlight. The light of fireflies is believed to have an alluring magic. Silver light is considered to invite riches.
data.obtainedFrom: Found near cold waters untouched by sunlight.

data.name: Sliver Of Meat
data.description: A slice of thinly carved beast flesh. Material used for crating items. Found by hunting herbivorous beast. The dried meat toughens the constitution.

data.name: Strip Of White Flesh
data.description: Thin strips of flesh taken from a bloodless creature. Material used for crafting items. The dried meat toughens the constitution, boosting resistance. It's known for its long-lasting effect.
data.obtainedFrom: Found by hunting creatures devoid of blood.

data.name: Tarnished Golden Sunflower
data.description: A large flower that blooms facing the Erdtree. Material used for crafting items. Found near Minor Erdtrees.

data.name: Toxic Mushroom
data.description: A mushroom covered in toxic mold that grows in rotten lands. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Trina's Lily
data.description: A pale purple water lily that is on the verge of wilting. Material used for crafting items. Exceedingly rare to find. A symbol of faith in St. Trina. Dulls the senses, preventing agitation.

data.name: Thin Beast Bones
data.description: Thin, hard beast bones. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting beasts.

data.name: Turtle Neck Meat
data.description: A splendid, lengthy cut of turtle neck meat. Material used for crafting items. Turtle meat is said to boost virility, but none in the Lands Between seem to have much appetite for it these days. In Lands Between, the urge to reproduce has waned long ago.

data.name: Volcanic Stone
data.description: A smoldering rock containing hot gas.

data.name: Yellow Ember
data.description: An ember taken from an eye socket of a corpse. Material used for crafting items.

data.name: Hefty Beast Bone
data.description: Thick, solid beast bones. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting particularly large beasts. Commonly Used to make disposable weapons.

data.name: Silver Tear Husk
data.description: A hardened husk shed by a formless life form known as the Silver Tear, found in and around the Eternal City. Material used for crafting items. The Silver Tear makes mockery of life, reborn again and again into imitation. Perhaps, one day, it will be reborn a lord...

data.name: Stormhawk Feather
data.description: A feather from a hawk that lived as one with the storms. Material used for crafting items. These feathers, enveloped in swirling winds, are often used for arrow fletching.

data.name: Arcane Sphere Of Faces
data.description: Safeguard of the Witchbane Ruins' basement cellar. Mysteriously rare and highly unconventional.

data.name: Giant Bat
data.description: The Giant Bats of Limgrave are nocturnal creatures and often rest during the day, unless they are disturbed.
data.location: Near the cliffs on Western Limgrave.

data.name: Lesser Runebear
data.description: Feral, often massive bears with runic patterns on their chest. Most commonly found scavenging the realms of The Lands Between or fighting other wild creatures.

data.name: Abnormal Stone Cluster
data.description: Bizarre catterpillar-shaped beings formed of moss-covered spherical stones and a disturbing eye that looks like that of a human being. They are commonly found as dull groups of seemingly lifeless rocks.

data.name: Bladed Talon Eagle
data.description: The servants of Stormveil come in many shapes, including Eagles that have been enslaved and fitted with blades. Driving them to attack those who approach

data.name: Boar
data.description: The Boars of Limgrave are less aggressive than normal, but should not be assumed to be passive
data.location: in Forests of Limgrave and Stormhill

data.name: Burning Slug
data.description: Burning Slugs move slowly and are located in the open field.

data.name: Crab
data.description: Crabs thrive in the shallow ponds of Agheel Lake and the shores of Limgrave
data.location: Roaming the beaches of Western Limgrave.

data.name: Construct
data.description: An Enemy made by Enemies

data.name: Deer
data.description: Deer roam freely in the plains on Limgrave, now that hunters have all but disappeared
data.location: West Limgrave, South West Liurnia of The Lakes

data.name: Dog
data.description: Roaming through the fields of Limgrave, wild Dogs should not be assumed to be docile nor dull.

data.name: Giant Dragonfly
data.description: The Great Dragonflies of Limgrave buzz and harass all creatures in their vicinity

data.name: Direwolf
data.description: Found alone or in small packs, these bloodthirsty beasts stalk the Lands Between with predatory fervor.
data.location: Caria Manor, Liurnia of the Lakes

data.name: Eagle
data.description: Majestic Eagles can be spotted among the cliffs, even during these times.

data.name: Giant Crab
data.description: Giant Crabs crowd the shores and shallows, attacking any who approach by swinging their powerful claws and spewing forth high-pressure water.
data.location: in the watery areas of Agheel Lake and the beaches of Western Limgrave

data.name: Giant Land Octopus
data.description: Giant Land Octopuses are a dangerous foe for any daring to visit the beaches of Limgrave.

data.name: Giant Lobster
data.description: The Lands Between are rife with all manner of life forms, naturally evolving over long periods and adapting to the environment. One such creature is the Giant Lobster — a creature that evolved to grow to such enormous sizes in order to better defend itself against much deadlier threats.

data.name: Giant Poison Flower
data.description: Giant Poison Flowers sprout in unlikely places, and summon down the elements on those who approach them
data.location: within Post Town Remains in Limgrave.

data.name: Guillemot
data.description: The Guillemot on the beaches of Limgrave are docile animals, but they are easily spooked
data.location: Roaming the beaches of Western Limgrave.

data.name: Lesser Runebear
data.description: Feral, often massive bears with runic patterns on their chest. Most commonly found scavenging the realms of The Lands Between or fighting other wild creatures.

data.name: Lesser Red Wolf Of Radagon
data.description: Hostile, over-sized wolves majestically covered in scarlet fur.

data.name: Lesser Spider Hand
data.description: Lesser Spider Hands are horrific creatures, surpassed only by their more powerful, gigantic counterparts.
data.location: Caria Manor, Liurnia of the Lakes, Mountaintops of the Giants

data.name: Land Octopus
data.description: The peculiar Land Octopus is a rather small but dangerous creature
data.location: In the watery areas of Agheel Lake and the beaches of Western Limgrave

data.name: Owl
data.description: Owls can be resting on the cliffs of Stormhill, and would even seem friendly and unconcerned by those passing by
data.location: perched on cliffs around Limgrave and Stormhill

data.name: Poison Flower
data.description: Poison Flowers grow near caves and cellars in Limgrave

data.name: Land Squirt
data.description: Land Squirts are repulsive shallow water creatures that emit a poison mist to kill and devour those nearby

data.name: Rat
data.description: Giant rats plague the mines and caves of Limgrave, spreading diseases where they go
data.location: Limgrave Tunnels, Ailing Village, Tombsward Cave

data.name: Rabbitgaroo
data.description: A species unique to The Lands Between, as adorable as scared.
data.location: Limgrave, South West Liurnia of the Lakes,

data.name: Rotten Stray
data.description: Undead dogs haunt the depths of Limgrave's mines, attacking all those who dwell into the tunnels

data.name: Sheep
data.description: The sheep from Limgrave have long forgotten captivity, romaing the landscape freely instead.
data.location: in the pastures of Limgrave and Stormhill

data.name: Skeletal Slime
data.description: Skeletal slime drudges the shores and shallows of Limgrave, looking for prey to consume
data.location: in the watery areas of Agheel Lake and the beaches of Western Limgrave

data.name: Spirit Jellyfish
data.description: Spirit Jellyfish are passive creatures seeking to protect, unless angered

data.name: Teardrop Scarab
data.description: There are both Crimson and Cerulean Teardrop Scarabs. Defeat them to replenish the flasks that match their type.

data.name: Spider Hand
data.description: Spider Hands skitter about their environs, often clinging to walls to put the drop on unsuspecting trespassers. They are also capable of burrowing deep beneath the earth, violently bursting out of the ground to grab and crush their prey.
data.location: Caria Manor, Liurnia of the Lakes, Mountaintops of the Giants
drops: Somber Smithing Stone (2), Somber Smithing Stone (7)

data.name: Wild Mouflon
data.description: Wild Mouflons become hostile when threatened and fight their aggressors by charging forward and striking them with their large horns.

data.name: Turtle
data.description: Turtles are passive creatures almost driven to extinction by those seeking its meat, said to have curative properties

data.name: Wolf
data.description: Wolves hunt the Lands Between in packs, and all those traveling should beware of their dangerous pack leaders

data.name: Prawn Miner
data.description: Hostile over-developed creatures resembling large shrimps. Remarkably agile.
data.location: Sellia Crystal Tunnel, Caelid Waypoint Ruins

data.name: Farum Azula Dragon
data.description: Farum Azula Dragons fly around the Farum Azula or what's left of it, if any of them notice someone roaming around, they will come to hunt the down. They have the power of thunder and they will use it aggresively towards enemies.

data.name: Bloody Finger Nerijus
data.description: Bloody Finger Nerijus follows the Bloody Finger code, hunting for fellow Tarnished without remorse
data.location: Invades on the ravine leading north-east from Agheel Lake, toward Murkwater Catacombs

data.name: Anastasia, Tarnished-eater
data.description: Invaded by Anastasia, Tarnished-Eater!

data.name: Bloody Finger Okina
data.location: Flame Peak, Mountaintops of the Giants

data.name: Edgar The Revenger
data.description: Edgar the Revenger is a warrior clad in medium armor and wields a halberd. His moveset involves mostly physical attacks and his poise is easily broken with magic.
data.location: Revenger's Shack, Liurnia of the Lakes

data.name: Maleigh Marais, Shaded Castle Castellan
data.description: Maleigh Marais's identity is completely shrouded by their mask and long robes. They are equipped with a rapier and move carefully around opponents. They are easily staggered with magic attacks such as Glintblade Phalanx.
data.location: Fields west of The Shaded Castle

data.name: Moongrum Carian Knight
data.description: Moongrum the Carian Knight is the guardian of Raya Lucaria Academy's Grand Library, he is the last line of defense against intruders who are wanting to slay the head sorcerer of the institute. Just like you, a Tarnished, Moongrum is capable of wielding two different weapons, a shield, can use sorcery, and even use Flasks to recover health. A true warrior of Raya Lucaria.

data.name: Recusant Henricus
data.description: Invaded by Recusant Henricus!

data.name: Albinauric
data.description: Due to their comically large and round heads, Albinaurics are perpetually hunched-over. They are often found in groups of five or more and they employ rudimentary combat tactics, often attacking recklessly with repeated swings and long combos that leave them open. At times, you may spot an Albinauric performing quick cartwheels on the battlefield, displaying agility despite their stature.

data.name: Albinauric Wolfback Archer
data.description: Guarding the rooftops of Ordina.

data.name: Banished Knight
data.description: A tall knight who was banished and bound to serve the Grafted Lord, and to kill those trespassers of Stormveil Castle. They are normally seen wielding a large weapon such as a longsword with a shield or a polearm, and they are fully protected with a complete set of armor.

data.name: Azula Beastman
data.description: The Beastmen of Farum Azula are ferocious half-man, half-beast warriors. They display remarkable agility and are proficient in a plethora of weaponry including various curved blades, greatswords, shields and spears. Many are also excellent marksmen with their unique curved throwing knives which they use with deadly precision.

data.name: Baleful Shadow
data.description: Assassins of the Two Fingers sent forth to carry out their dirty work

data.name: Blackflame Monk
data.description: Mysterious hooded figures belonging to an order of monks that call upon the power of the Black Flame, as well as their astute martial prowess to fell foes and trespassers of their domains.

data.name: Black Knight
data.description: The Black Knight, riding atop a dark steed, wielding a mighty halberd.
data.location: Limgrave, south-east of the telescope, patrolling on a bridge

data.name: Godrick Knight
data.description: Wielders of heavy swords and spears, protected by large shields and fully armored. These Knights are often aided in combat by soldiers or hostile dogs, therefore posing a threat to the unprepared and novice.

data.name: Castle Guard
data.description: Castle Guards comprise the bulk of Stormveil's defenses, but are by no means the most dangerous of the many great ones within.

data.name: Chanting Winged Dame
data.description: The Chanting Winged Dames of Liurnia of The Lakes are equally hostile as they are suspicious.
data.location: Ruin-Strewn Precipice, Liurnia of The Lakes, Fort Faroth

data.name: Commoner
data.description: The Commoner is a servant that is bound to perform duties for their superiors within Stormveil Castle. They appear to be tall, slender, yet weak, who is still capable of fighting trespassers.

data.name: Demi-human
data.description: Agile and hostile, Demi-Humans scavenge the land in groups commanded by a leader, a stronger and more menacing creature. They roam the field light-armored and wielding a wide range of melee weapons and wooden shields.
data.location: Caves and beaches of Limgrave, such as Dissenter's Cave.

data.name: Fire Monk
data.description: Fire Monks hierarchically gather in ceremonies, often at night, burning their way through Liurnia of The Lakes with torches and Mobile Flamethrowers. Fire Monk Abbots have the powerful ability of bursting flames from their hands and must be fought carefully.

data.name: Sorcerer Miner
data.description: Frail and malnourished, Diggers wield a glintstone-imbued staff for mining which doubles as a weapon when push comes to shove.

data.name: Flame Guardian
data.description: Flame Guardians are slender humanoids dressed in simple white garbs and wearing a bronze mask, concealing their identity. They are equipped with long, flaming poles/staves and wield fire magic.

data.name: Glintstone Sorcerer
data.description: Glintstone Sorcerers are decked in Raya Lucarian Robes and distinct Glintstone Crown masks that obscure their identity. These scholars have access to lower level spells such as Glintstone Pebble, among others.

data.name: Gnoll
data.description: Hungry Gnolls are usually found eating from dead bodies which makes them vulnerable to surprise or stealth attacks, but they are quick and unforgivingly lethal. They come in different classes, some of the wield a sword and use it very acrobatically, other use shields and some even are able to cast thunder.

data.name: Godrick Soldier
data.description: The Godrick Soldiers of the Lands Between now roam the landscape, their clothes rags, hoping to rebuild their lives
data.location: Gatefront Ruins, Castle Morne, Stormgate, Roaming the Limgrave landscape

data.name: Golem
data.description: Golems lay inactive in the hills of Stormhill, but those foolish enough to wake them will soon curse their fate
data.location: West ruins of Stormhill., Castle Morne Entrance, Ainsel River Well, Leyndell, Royal Capital

data.name: Highwayman
data.description: Former foot soldiers who have turned to banditry. Clandestine and secluded from civilazation, now they lie in hidden caves.

data.name: Great Horned Tragoth
data.description: Invading another world. Defeat Great Horned Tragoth!

data.name: Gold Dragon Cult Knight
data.description: Exceedingly tough and skillful Knight, a golden armor-wearing menace lethal to most. Highly trained warrior and a threatening adversary due to its fine combat skills.

data.name: Imp
data.description: Imps infest many catacombs in the Lands Between, although some theorize they could be protecting their secrets

data.name: Imp Miner
data.description: Small and agile creatures that typically conceal themselves within a smokescreen., Often wielding an axe or a flail amd performing flying attacks.

data.name: Invisible Warrior
data.description: Sneak warriors, patient and quick to get in your back.

data.name: Imp
data.description: Imps infest many catacombs in the Lands Between, although some theorize they could be protecting their secrets

data.name: Lesser Burial Watchdog
data.description: A living construct fashioned after felines and hounds, made to watch over catacombs. These constructs wield massive stone weaponry and are attuned to different elements.

data.name: Knight Of Zamor
data.description: Knights of Zamor are slender humanoids with long hair, wielding a peculiar curved blade. These warriors are graceful and perform almost dance-like maneuvers as they weave across the battlefield. As denizens of the Mountaintops of the Giants, Knights of Zamor are strongly attuned to Frost, utilizing its powers to bolster their swordplay.

data.name: Lesser Pumpkin Head
data.description: The Lesser Pumpkin Head is a weaker variant of the Pumpkin Head. It appears to be an outcast due to its appearance and is mainly used as one of a weapon to fight against intruders and trespassers alike. The Lesser Pumpkin Head can be seen wearing a Pumpkin Helm, a distressed cloak, and wields a large club.
data.location: Castle Morne, Raya Lucaria Academy, Limgrave

data.name: Lesser Ulcerated Tree Spirit
data.description: A guardian that sleeps deep within the crypt of Stormveil Castle. It is quick and very aggressive when it attacks and moves similar to a centipede with its multiple legs. The Lesser Ulcerated Tree Spirit also features two large arms and a tail that it mainly uses to swing around or to slam the ground.

data.name: Living Jar
data.description: The Living Jar, a walking vase that has long arms used for reaching and attacking their foes. A Living Jar may appear small in a group and it can also appear as a singular giant entity, capable of using slow, yet strong attacks.

data.name: Lesser Wormface
data.description: Lesser Wormface may not be as large as Wormface itself but they can be found roaming around in groups around Crumbling Farum Azula.

data.name: Maneuverable Flamethrower
data.description: Large wagons operated from the inside that shoot fire from a sculpture's mouth.

data.name: Marionette Gargoyle
data.description: The Marionette Gargoyle are statues within Raya Lucaria Academy that have been reanimated with magical properties. They mainly fly in the air and wield a scythe that they use to attack their foes. They are usually found on posts, pretending to be statues.

data.name: Marionette Soldier
data.description: Marionette Soldiers are puppets that are created and given life by superior being that reside within Raya Lucaria Academy. Their purpose is to protect and stop intruders from entering the institute. These soldiers appear to have multiple arms wielding more than one weapon, making them unpredictable in regards to how they will strike.
data.location: Raya Lucaria Academy, Academy Gate Town, Raya Lucaria Crystal Tunnel, Witchbane Ruins

data.name: Miner
data.description: The ever working miners of Limgrave know no life but their toil, and will fiercely defend it
data.location: Limgrave Tunnels, Sellia Crystal Tunnel, Ruin-Strewn Precipice

data.name: Mounted Northern Mercenary
data.description: Mounted Northern Mercenaries are often seen guarding important deliveries and outposts, such as Stormgate

data.name: Mounted Knight
data.location: North-east region of Limgrave, North of Liurnia of the Lakes

data.name: Noble Sorcerer
data.description: Noble Sorcerers are frail old men wearing tattered garbs and a dirty yellow cape. They use a standard glintstone staff as both a sorcery catalyst and walking stick.

data.name: Misbegotten
data.description: The Misbegotten are small humanoid creatures with small wings on their backs and a tail that reaches to the ground. Treated as slaves or worse from the time they are born, they rush in attack wildly and ruthlessly with their Iron Cleavers.
data.location: Castle Morne, Weeping Peninsula, Mt. Gelmir

data.name: Kaiden Sellsword
data.description: Kaiden Sellswords roam the land, looking to be hired for several protection roles

data.name: Omen
data.description: A large ogre that is kept imprisoned within the grounds of Stormveil Castle. It appears to be battered and treated violently to discipline it, and used as a weapon to fight against trespassers.

data.name: Pendulum Statue
data.description: A golden statue that sits on a small wagon. Attached to it are two pendulum blades that can extend to capture its prey. The Pendulum Statue is being controlled by an unkown creature that rests within it, only by opening its chest will it reveal its root-like tentacles.

data.name: Old Knight Istvan
data.description: Invading another world. Defeat Old Knight Istvan!

data.name: Pumpkin Head
data.description: The breaking disrupted the flora and fauna of the region. Some took a rather intense liking to the larger plants that emerged

data.name: Raya Lucaria Sorcerer
data.description: Academicians of the Raya Lucaria Academy. These sholars dedicate their lives to learning and mastering the art of sorcery and serve one superiror sorcerer who resides within the institute. They are able to use glintstone sorcery to strike their foes from afar, and are still capable of using their weapon for close-quarters combat.

data.name: Rileigh The Idle
data.description: Invading another world. Defeat Rileigh the Idle!

data.name: Revenant
data.description: A grotesque amalgamation of limbs, the Revenant is a creature with the body structure of an arachnid and the face of a human. Much like a spider, it possesses many limbs that seem to have been grafted onto its body, taken from diseased humans. The Revenant is capable of traveling through portals it creates with a peculiar form of magic, swiftly emerging behind a foe to catch them off guard.

data.name: Servant Of Rot
data.description: Servants of Rot relish in the pungent miasma expelled by Poison Flowers. Their bodies are heavily mutated by the rot, their heads transformed into large crowns of fungi. These presumably former humans know only the rot and they worship it like a deity, bathed in its fog of decay.

data.name: Raya Lucarian Warden
data.description: Wardens roam the halls of the Raya Lucaria Academy, armed and watchful for furtive marauders.

data.name: Soldier
data.description: Soldiers defend the many outposts of the Lords from incoming threats, such as the Tarnished
data.location: Stormveil Castle, Stormhill, Main Limgrave, Weeping Peninsula

data.name: Skeleton Mage
data.description: Skeleton Mages are usually found on graveyards in Liurnia of the Lakes. They can out from the ground, they can be found in groups, wielding scythes and constantly casting a spell launching ghostly skulls against you.

data.name: Skeleton
data.description: Skeletons rise from cemeteries and ruins of the Lands Between, attacking relentlessly any who approach
data.location: In the beaches and dungeons of Limgrave, and in the cemetery area of Stormhill

data.name: Slender Wayfarer
data.description: A rare and long-haired creature, tall and slender, often found at the shore.

data.name: Swordstress
data.description: Nimble warriors protecting and patrolling the eternal cities.

data.name: Troll
data.description: The Trolls of the Lands Between are frequently enslaved for defensive positions, but are also used in lieu of beasts of burden
data.location: Along the road north of the Collapsed bridge

data.name: Troll Knight
data.description: Trolls are often employed to guard key locations, such as staircases large enough to accommodate their massive bodies. Often unmatched in strength, it bears the question... What manner of creature poses enough of a threat such that the mighty troll would find itself in need of heavy armor...?
data.location: Caria Manor, Liurnia of the Lakes

data.name: Undead Soldier
data.description: Undead creatures, decayed and struggling to maintain balance while roaming the fields of The Lands Between.

data.name: Twinsage Sorcerer
data.description: Twinsage Sorcerers are distinguished from other scholars by the crowns worn on their head, depicting the Twinsage Conspectus, with distinct blue crystals forming at the top of the twin heads.

data.name: Wraith Caller
data.description: As their name suggests, Wraith Callers are equipped with Wraith Calling Bells that they use to channel death magic, summoning vengeful spirits to attack those that dare intrude upon the ruins of Liurnia. Devout worshippers of the Revenants, Wraith Callers are able to utilize the Revenants' dimensional portals, albeit to a lesser extent.

data.name: Hero
data.description: A stalwart Hero, at home with a battleaxe, descended from a badlands chieftain

data.name: Warrior
data.description: A twinblade wielding warrior from a nomadic tribe. An origin of exceptional technique

data.name: Astrologer
data.description: A scholar who reads fate in the stars. Heir to the school of glintstone sorcery

data.name: Bandit
data.description: A dangerous bandit who strikes for weak points. Excels at ranged combat with bows

data.name: Prisoner
data.description: A prisoner bound in an iron mask. Studied in glintstone sorcery, having lived among the elite prior to sentencing.

data.name: Vagabond
data.description: A knight exiled from their homeland to wander. A solid, armor-clad origin.

data.name: Confessor
data.description: A church spy adept at covert operations. Equally adept with a sword as they are with incantations

data.name: Wretch
data.description: A poor purposeless osd naked as they day they were born. A nice club is all they have

data.name: Prophet
data.description: A seer ostracized for inauspicious prophecies. Well versed in healing incantations

data.name: Samurai
data.description: A capable fighter from the distant land of reeds. Handy with Katana and Longbows

data.name: Warrior
data.description: A twinblade wielding warrior from a nomadic tribe. An origin of exceptional technique

data.name: Enchanted Knight
data.description: These Knights have embraced the power of Glintstone, facing enemies in melee combat while simultaneously casting spells. They often seek out and destroy those who use magic for nefarious purposes.

data.name: Bloody Wolf
data.description: The Wolf is cunning, steadfast and deadly. These warriors have no fear and face down death with unmatched vigor and pride.

data.name: Champion
data.description: Equipped with a Sacred Seal and an Axe, the Champion can burn foes from a distance or take them head on in melee combat. They are ferocious fighters, who do not fear death.

data.name: Abductor Virgins
data.description: Deadly mechanical constructs who wield massive blades.

data.name: Alecto, Black Knife Ringleader
data.description: Remarkably agile and aggressive warrior. Dangerous even for those with shield coverage...
data.location: Ringleader's Evergoal, Liurnia of the Lakes

data.name: Alecto Black Knife Ringleader
data.description: Remarkably agile and aggressive warrior. Dangerous even for those with shield coverage...

data.name: Alabaster Lord
data.description: An Evergaol prisoner wielding a vicious sword and the void with murderous intent.
data.location: Royal Grave Evergaol, Liurnia of the Lakes

data.name: Adan, Thief Of Fire
data.description: An evergaol prisoner and former battle mage, Adan wields a spiked flail and uses stolen knowledge of fire magic to great effect.

data.name: Ancient Dragon Lansseax
data.description: Lansseax was the sister of Fortissax. It is said that she took the from of a human to commune with the knights as a priestess of the ancient dragon cult.

data.name: Ancestor Spirit
data.description: A glowing spirit that takes the form of a large deer, making it a menacing threat when charging at targets.

data.name: Ancient Hero Of Zamor
data.description: Noticeably agile, frost-made creature suceptible to magic attacks.

data.name: Beast Clergyman
data.description: Temporarily overtaken by their bestial rage, the Beast Clergyman attacks ferociously, throwing rocks and themselves at their foes. Calm their aggression and return them to their senses.

data.name: Astel, Stars Of Darkness
data.description: A hostile, massive Dragon-Fly creature. Menacing and extremely powerful.
data.location: Yelough Anix Tunnel in Consecrated Snowfield

data.name: Beast Of Farum Azula
data.description: Underground-living creature found at Groveside Cave

data.name: Beastman Of Farum Azula
data.description: The beasts of Groveside Cave rally around the prowess of the Beastman of Farum Azula

data.name: Bell Bearing Hunter
data.description: Menacing and slow-paced, it wields a large, red-glowing sword and a shield combined with a full body armor and a chilling cape.
data.location: Warmaster's Shack, Northern Stormhill, Church of Vows, East Liurnia, Hermit Merchant's Shack, Leyndell Royal Captial, Dragonbarrow, North Caelid

data.name: Black Blade Kindred
data.description: Imposing Gargoyle wielding a massive armament

data.name: Black Knife Assassin
data.description: Relentless and agile dark figures carrying a
data.location: Deathtouched Catacombs, Black Knife CatacombsSage's Cave

data.name: Bloodhound Knight Darriwil
data.description: The merciless bloodhounds attack with grace and agility, never backing down or giving a moment's rest.

data.name: Burial Tree Watchdog
data.description: A large feline-hound looking guardian that serves as a "Watchdog"for the Burial Tree of the Stormfoot Catacombs.

data.name: Cleanrot Knight
data.description: Powerful, dexterous Knight capable of distanced, very rapid attacks. Its spear and sword are a threat to any light-armored fighter.
data.location: Stillwater Cave, Liurnia of the Lakes

data.name: Borealis The Freezing Fog
data.description: Frost Dragon guarding the frozen lake of Mountaintop of Giants, emits a permanent blizzard.

data.name: Commander Niall
data.description: Commander Niall is a tall and built knight with a peg leg, clad in heavy armor, wielding a halberd that doubles as a battle standard. He is accompanied by two Spectral Banished Knights, one equipped with dual swords and the other equipped with a sword and shield.

data.name: Commander O'neil
