data.description: A large and imposing human commander who wields a halberd that doubles as a battle standard, rousing his spirit minions to battle with unquenchable fervor.

data.name: Crucible Knight Ordovis
data.description: Large, heavy and fully armored. With the ability to materialize fiery wings and attack from above. Attacks with the huge power of Ordivis's Greatsword and a Greatshield. Slow, but extremely tough and highly dangerous.

data.name: Crystalians
data.description: Crystal energy in the form of a human with devastating power.

data.name: Deathbird
data.description: A bipedal bird with arms and a bird skull for a head and is found in various locations
data.location: Limgrave, Weeping Peninsula, Liurnia of the Lakes

data.name: Decaying Ekzykes
data.description: A pale white dragon — its scales blighted by the same scarlet rot that plagues the region of Caelid. It silently waits along the southern highway, awaiting unsuspecting travelers to fall prey to its deathly onslaught.

data.name: Demi-human Chief
data.description: The darkness of Coastal Cave hides a den of those who may look almost human, but are certainly not.

data.name: Demi-human Queen Maggie
data.description: Sovereign Demi-Human creature roaming the lands of Mt. Gelmir

data.name: Divine Bridge Golem
data.description: Enormously large and lethargic Golem that slowly storms into battle when it becomes aware of your presence.

data.name: Demi-human Queen Margot
data.description: Sovereign Demi-Human creature concealed within isolated caves.

data.name: Draconic Tree Sentinel
data.description: Massive knight clad in golden armor atop a giant horse.

data.name: Dragonkin Soldier
data.description: A large, hostile humanoid creature awaken from its drowse straight into battle.

data.name: Cemetery Shade
data.description: Amorphous and shadowy being belonging to the catacombs
data.location: Tombsward Catacombs, Black Knife Catacombs,Caelid Catacombs,

data.name: Crucible Knight
data.description: A formidable, dexterous fighter skilled in melee combat.
data.location: Stormhill Evergaol,, Stormveil Castle,, Auriza Hero's Grave

data.name: Dragonkin Soldier Of Nokstella
data.description: Huge humanoid-like creature located at the underground caves of Uhl Palace Ruins

data.name: Dragonlord Placidusax
data.description: A massive in size, two-headed dragon capable of immense acts of annihilation.

data.name: Elden Beast
data.description: It is said that long ago, the Greater Will sent a golden star bearing a beast into the Lands Between, which would later become the Elden Ring.

data.name: Elemer Of The Briar
data.description: Wielding the stolen sword from the Marais family, Elemer of the Briar stands at the top of the castle waiting.

data.name: Esgar, Priest Of Blood
data.description: A highly aggressive humanoid priest

data.name: Erdtree Avatar
data.description: A large headless create which resembles a tree stump.
data.location: Minor Erdtree (Weeping Peninsula), Minor Erdtree (Liurnia Southwest), Minor Erdtree (Liurnia Northeast), Minor Erdtree (Caelid), Minor Erdtree (Mountaintops East)

data.name: Fallingstar Beast
data.description: A massive quadruped with a long spiky tail and a head reminiscent of a centipede's, with massive mandibles protruding from its face. It behaves much like a bull and appears to have seismic powers, allowing it to control the earth within its chamber.
data.location: Sellia Crystal Tunnel, Caelid, Altus Plateau

data.name: Fell Twins
data.description: Two bulky ogre-like creatures fighting side by side with red-hot armament

data.name: Fia's Champions
data.description: Five invaders summoned in an endurance combat in three waves.

data.name: Flying Dragon Agheel
data.description: A feared-by-most massive dragon located within the Dragon-Burnt Ruins in Limgrave

data.name: Fire Giant
data.description: Upon realizing the flames of their forge would never die, Queen Marika, marked him with a curse. "O trifling giant, mayest thou tend thy, flame for eternity.

data.name: Flying Dragon Greyll
data.description: A large grey dragon, Flying Dragon Greyll patrols the bridge breathing fire and flying down on those trying to cross.

data.name: Frenzied Duelist
data.description: A humanoid with heavy armor and a massive axe.

data.name: God-devouring Serpent
data.description: A massive, menacing reptile that poses a remarkable threat.

data.name: Glintstone Dragon Smarag
data.description: A fearsome magic dragon with crystalized magic stone for scales. Jealously guards the entrance to the Academy's Crystal Cave.

data.name: Glintstone Dragon Adula
data.description: A powerful and devastating dragon, a menace for all type of fighters.

data.name: Godefroy The Grafted
data.description: A member of Godrick the Grafted's family imprisoned by the Dragon Knight during the War of the Shattering.

data.name: Godfrey, First Elden Lord (hoarah Loux)
data.description: I've given thee courtesy enough. Now I fight as Hoarah Loux. Warrior!

data.name: Godfrey, First Elden Lord (golden Shade)
data.description: Physical form of Godfrey, First Elden Lord

data.name: Godrick The Grafted
data.description: Godrick the Grafted is the ruler of Stormveil Castle, wielding a large golden axe. He has grafted many arms on his body, a symbol of power to all those who might try to depose him.
drops: Godrick's Great Rune, Remembrance of the Grafted

data.name: Godskin Apostle
data.description: The apostles, one said to serve Destined Death, are wielders of the god-slaying black flame. But after their defeat by Maliketh, the Black Blade, the source of their power was sealed away.

data.name: Godskin Apostle And Godskin Noble
data.description: They are found in their spirit forms, spawned by the opportunist Spirit-Caller Snail.
data.location: Spiritcaller Cave, Mountaintops of the Giants

data.name: Death Rite Bird
data.description: Immense bird skeleton with crow-like features. Rushes to battle from above while wielding a giant spear.

data.name: Godskin Apostle
data.description: The apostles, one said to serve Destined Death, are wielders of the god-slaying black flame. But after their defeat by Maliketh, the Black Blade, the source of their power was sealed away.

data.name: Godskin Noble
data.description: The most aggresive of the Godskin.

data.name: Grafted Scion
data.description: An amorphous blob that wields two swords and a shield, and appears to be grafted with multiple arms.

data.name: Great Wyrm Theodorix
data.description: A dragon wyrm with immense power.
data.location: North of Albinauric Rise in Mountaintops of the Giants

data.name: Hoarah Loux, Warrior
data.description: Chieftain of the Badland Warriors.

data.name: Kindred Of Rot
data.description: Large, prawn-like creatures skilled at melee combat. Its Pest's Glaive poses a menace when wielded by these agile beings.

data.name: Guardian Golem
data.description: The Guardian Golem, magical constructs that has been cut and chiseled from stone. It is the sole guardian of the Highroad Cave who holds a precious item.

data.name: Godskin Duo
data.description: A complementing pair of creatures extremely well versed in dual-battling. These beings achieve an exceptionally balance in combat, resulting in a devastating synergy.
drops: Ash of War: Black Flame Tornado

data.name: Kindred Of Rot
data.description: Large, prawn-like creatures skilled at melee combat. Its Pest's Glaive poses a menace when wielded by these agile beings.

data.name: Leonine Misbegotten
data.description: Aggressive and feral, the Misbegotten sees nothing but rage

data.name: Lichdragon Fortissax
data.description: Massive four winged black dragon with the ability to wield lightning.

data.name: Mad Pumpkin Head
data.description: A huge ogre-looking creature that has a large pumpkin helmet worn on its head. It wields a massive flail and seems to be guarding something or someone against intruders.
data.location: Waypoint Ruins, Limgrave, Caelem Ruins, Caelid

data.name: Magma Wyrm
data.description: A large lesser dragon with bronze-colored scales covering its body. Magma Wyrms inhabit deep cave systems and volcanos, thriving within lava-flooded environments.

data.name: Lion Guardian
data.description: The Lion Guardian of Stormveil has been coerced into service by cruel means

data.name: Malenia, Blade Of Miquella
data.description: ...Heed my words. I am Malenia. Blade of Miquella. And I have never known defeat.

data.name: Maliketh, The Black Blade
data.description: O, Death. Become my blade once more.

data.name: Miranda The Blighted Bloom
data.description: A giant poison flower that is deadlier than it looks.
data.location: Weeping Peninsula: Tombsward Cave, Altus Plains: Perfumer's Grotto

data.name: Mimic Tear
data.description: An eccentric being capable of taking a comprehensive shape of its adversary, ranging from body features to armament.

data.name: Misbegotten Crusader
data.description: The Lord of Frenzied Flame.
data.location: Cave of the Forlorn in Mountaintops of the Giants

data.name: Mohg, Lord Of Blood
data.description: Welcome, honored guest. To the birthplace of our Dynasty!

data.name: Mohg, The Omen
data.description: The Lord of Frenzied Flame

data.name: Magma Wyrm Makar
data.description: Aggressive Fire Wyrm guarding the entrance to Altus Plains from any who attempt to bypass the lift

data.name: Necromancer Garris
data.description: A humanoid necromancer draped in a red cloth. Efficient in the death sorceries.

data.name: Nox Swordstress & Nox Priest
data.description: A duo of warriors comprised of the female Swordstress, who uses a sword with a whip-like function to attack at medium range and a male Priest who uses spells from afar.

data.name: Night's Cavalry
data.description: Imposing knight figure atop a dark steed, wielding a large flail or halberd.
drops: Ash of War: Poison Moth Flight

data.name: Omenkiller
data.description: An omninous figure wielding two serrated swords.
data.location: Village of the Albinaurics, Volcano Manor, Perfumer's Grotto

data.name: Onyx Lord
data.description: The Onyx Lords, who had skin of stone, were called lords in reverential fear of their destructive power.

data.name: Perfumer Tricia
data.description: A long range spellcaster complemented by an armored, short-distance warrior.

data.name: Putrid Grave Warden Duelist
data.description: Grave Wardens protect the secrets of the ancients, but the corruption of the land has affected them too

data.name: Pumpkin Head
data.description: The breaking disrupted the flora and fauna of the region. Some took a rather intense liking to the larger plants that emerged

data.name: Putrid Tree Spirit
data.description: A blood-rotted tree that has found life despite the death that consumes it.

data.name: Radagon Of The Golden Order
data.description: Lord Radagon was a great champion, possessed of flowing red locks. He came to these lands at the head of a great golden host, when he met Lady Rennala in battle. He soon repented his territorial transgressions though, and became husband to the Carian Queen. However. When Godfrey, first Elden Lord, was hounded from the Lands Between, Radagon left Rennala to return to the Erdtree Capital, becoming Queen Marika's second husband and King Consort. Taking the title... of second Elden Lord.

data.name: Red Wolf Of Radagon
data.description: Fierce guardian and protector of its master, even when it has long left.
data.location: Raya Lucaria Academy, Liurnia of the Lakes

data.name: Red Wolf Of The Champion
data.description: A ferocious red wolf with large fangs and blistering speed.

data.name: Regal Ancestor Spirit
data.description: A spirit glowing in pale blue light, suspended in the air and taking the shape of a huge deer.

data.name: Royal Knight Loretta
data.description: The eternal guardian of Caria Manor fervently defends her domain atop the Royal Moongazing Grounds. Loretta uses her greatbow to rain destruction on all who would dare approach the estate grounds.

data.name: Royal Revenant
data.description: An obscene and disturbing abomination, blend of a spider-like creature and human limbs resulting in a quite resourceful fighter at close range.
data.location: Kingsrealm Ruins, Liurnia of the Lakes

data.name: Runebear
data.description: Ferocious, robust creature that's huge in size and remarkably agressive.

data.name: Rykard, Lord Of Blasphemy
data.description: Join the Serpent King, as family... Together, we will devour the very gods!

data.name: Scaly Misbegotten
data.description: A troll like scavenger with an insatiable taste for blood.

data.name: Sir Gideon Ofnir, The All-knowing
data.description: Sir Gideon Ofnir, now far from the books and immersed in battle.

data.name: Soldier Of Godrick
data.description: An esteemed high rank soldier, who wields a massive sword and wears his armor proudly.

data.name: Spirit-caller Snail
data.description: The ultimate Spiritcaller.
drops: Ash of War: Black Flame Tornado

data.name: Starscourge Radahn
data.description: General Radahn is cursed ever to wander. Eaten from the inside, by Malenia's scarlet rot, his Wits are long gone. Now he gathers the corpses of former friends and foes alike, gorging on them, like a dog.
drops: Remembrance of the Starscourge, Radahn's Great Rune

data.name: Tibia Mariner
data.description: Tibia Mariner is a spectral sailor capable of calling forth the aid of undead Skeleton creatures and is mainly found at northeast Summonwater Village in Limgrave, near the limits with Caelir. This is an optional boss as players must not defeat it in order to advance to the Legacy Dungeon.
data.location: Summonwater Village, Liurnia of The Lakes, Wyndham Ruins

data.name: Ulcerated Tree Spirit
data.description: A corrupted and deformed tree that lurks in Mt. Gelmir.

data.name: Valiant Gargoyle
data.description: Just like the wielder, the missing parts have been mended with corpse wax; a patchwork of champions.

data.name: Wormface
data.description: A ghastly blood rotted tree with the face of a hundred worms.

data.name: Tree Sentinel
data.description: The heavily armored and highly decorated sentinel protects the tree. Who would dare oppose him?

data.name: All-knowing Greaves
data.description: Greaves set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear. At the end that should not be.

data.name: All-knowing Armor
data.description: Armor set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear. At the end that should not be.

data.name: All-knowing Helm
data.description: Helm set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear. At the end that should not be.

data.name: Alberich's Robe (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Mad Tongue Alberich's robe.

data.name: All-knowing Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the All-knowing Armor.

data.name: Aristocrat Coat
data.description: Tanned leather coat adorned with fine gold embroidery. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital, and the belonging of a family which claims a knight as an ancestor. Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

data.name: Aristocrat Garb
data.description: High quality garb adorned with fine golden embroidery. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Terribly faded and tattered. Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

data.name: Aristocrat Garb (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Aristocrat Garb.

data.name: All-knowing Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear. At the end that should not be.

data.name: Alberich's Robe
data.description: Mad Tongue Alberich's robe.

data.name: Azur's Glintstone Robe
data.description: A robe reserved for grant masters at the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Corroded by blue-green glintstones.

data.name: Battlemage Robe
data.description: Robe worn by scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy scholar, tattered from being worn on the battlefield.

data.name: Banished Knight Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Banished Knight Armor.

data.name: Astrologer Robe
data.description: Robe fashioned from supple cloth. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above. They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers. But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

data.name: Bandit Garb
data.description: Leather garb worn by bandits.

data.name: Astrologer Robe (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Astrologer Robe

data.name: Beast Champion Armor
data.description: Silver armor engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant. Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was. Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

data.name: Black Knife Armor
data.description: Scale armor used by the Black Knife Assassins, forged to make no sound. Traces of power yet remain in its concealing veil, which muffles the sound of footsteps. The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

data.name: Beast Champion Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the  Best Champion Armor

data.name: Banished Knight Armor
data.description: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. This armor was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

data.name: Black Knife Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Black Knife Armor

data.name: Bloodsoaked Tabard
data.description: Padded cloth armor with indelible bloodstains around the neck. Worn by headless foot soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.

data.name: Bloodhound Knight Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Bloodhound Knight Armor

data.name: Blaidd's Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Blaidd's Armor

data.name: Bloodhound Knight Armor
data.description: Metal armor with a jutting breastplate.  Worn by the Bloodhound Knights.

data.name: Blackflame Monk Armor
data.description: Black iron armor adorned with ashen cloth.

data.name: Blaidd's Armor
data.description: Well-worn black armor of the man-wolf Blaidd

data.name: Blue Silver Mail Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Blue Silver Mail Armor

data.name: Blue Festive Garb
data.description: Ceremonial garb worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills. Use of this garb, dyed in a stunning blue, is only permitted for the young maids who play the central role in the festival.

data.name: Blue Cloth Vest
data.description: Vest of a nomadic warrior. The blue color of its fabric symbolizes brisk waters, as fluid and flowing as the sword in the hand of its wearer. Just as still waters turn foul, stagnation leads to decay. Warriors must remain ever drifting.

data.name: Blue Silver Mail Armor
data.description: Chainmail armor crafted with blue silver. Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers. Blue silver is a metal born from the same mother as the archers themselves, and provides protection from magic and frost.

data.name: Brave's Battlewear
data.description: Battlewear fashioned from leather armor adorned with a large sheet of cloth. Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands The red cloth signifies participation in the Long March long, long ago and this ceremonial garb beseeches the favor of the Warrior King who led them.

data.name: Briar Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Briar Armor

data.name: Carian Knight Armor
data.description: Armor of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family. The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.

data.name: Briar Armor
data.description: Battered iron armor from a foreign land. Worn by Elemer of the Briar.

data.name: Carian Knight Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Carian Knight Armor

data.name: Brave's Battlewear (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Brave's Battlewear

data.name: Chain Armor
data.description: Armor made of woven chain. Standard issue for ordinary soldiers. Though plain in appearance, it offers dependable protection.

data.name: Champion Pauldron
data.description: Pauldron reserved for the badlands' bravest. Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes. Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

data.name: Bull-goat Armor
data.description: Great Horned Tragoth's armor. Covers its wearer with a pair of giant horns, providing staunch poise.

data.name: Chain-draped Tabard
data.description: Padded cloth armor with a chainmail shawl draped over the shoulders. Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

data.name: Cloth Garb
data.description: Clothing made of coarse material, commonly worn in the Lands Between.

data.name: Cleanrot Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Cleanrot Armor

data.name: Commoner's Garb (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Commoner's Garb

data.name: Cleanrot Armor
data.description: Armor of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering. The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles fiercest of all.

data.name: Commoner's Garb
data.description: Garb with a thick embroidered cape attached. Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

data.name: Confessor Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Confessor Armor

data.name: Confessor Armor
data.description: Black leather armor for blending in with the darkness. Worn by church confessors. The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace. The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

data.name: Commoner's Simple Garb
data.description: Garb with a modest cloth cape attached. Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between. The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.

data.name: Commoner's Simple Garb (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Commoner's Simple Garb

data.name: Consort's Robe
data.description: Fine robe of white silk worn by Tanith, Lady of the Volcano Manor.

data.name: Crucible Axe Armor
data.description: Armor of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. Worn by the knight Ordovis and his men. Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

data.name: Corhyn's Robe
data.description: Robe of Corhyn the cleric. Even after exile, Corhyn refused to recant his prophecies. And for this, he was blessed with the guidance of grace. Since then, the cart wheel draped on his neck has served as a reminder. That true guidance awaits those with iron wills. Those with unwavering faith.

data.name: Crucible Tree Armor
data.description: Armor of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. Worn by the knight Siluria and her men. Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

data.name: Crucible Axe Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Crucible Axe Armor

data.name: Crucible Tree Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Crucible Tree Armor

data.name: Cuckoo Surcoat
data.description: Armor worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers. The surcoat depicts twinned cuckoos peering into a flourishing mass of glintstone. To a glintstone sorcerer, the body is a transient thing. The Cuckoo alone knows its insignificance, yet watches over it all the same.

data.name: Cuckoo Knight Armor
data.description: Armor worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights.

data.name: Cuckoo Knight Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Cuckoo Knight Armor

data.name: Deathbed Dress
data.description: Extremely thin and sheer white dress worn by the Deathbed Companion as she embraces the dead. Slowly replenishes the HP of nearby allies, but not that of the wearer. The touch of the fabric is exceedingly soft, so as not to harm even the most withered corpse, while still sharing her warmth.

data.name: Depraved Perfumer Robe
data.description: Robe worn by depraved perfumers. The embroidery on the apron is itself a curse upon the Erdtree. These heresy-inclined perfumers imbibe their own spices to alter body and mind. Their slow descent into self-destruction is  what earned them their name.

data.name: Drake Knight Armor
data.description: Black iron armor worn by drake knights. Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partake of communion. The cape is crafted with dragon wing membrane.

data.name: Drake Knight Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Drake Knight Armor

data.name: Depraved Perfumer Robe (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Depraved Perfumer Robe

data.name: Elden Lord Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Elden Lord Armor

data.name: Elden Lord Armor
data.description: Armor of Godfrey the first Elden Lord. The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield. He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

data.name: Dirty Chainmail
data.description: Chainmail worn by young Albinaurics. The appearance of a protruding belly provides no benefits worthy of note.

data.name: Errant Sorcerer Robe
data.description: Commonplace robe made of thick cloth. Worn by the Errant Sorcerer Wilhelm, one of the first Tarnished to visit Roundtable Hold. A silent seeker of sorcery, who had gone so far as to make contact with the primeval current, Wilhelm was led by guidance into confrontation with his friend Vargram, and it is said that he was then taken prisoner in Roundtable Hold.

data.name: Erdtree Surcoat
data.description: Armor worn by soldiers sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. The surcoat bears a majestic likeness of the Erdtree. Its golden backing is an honor bestowed on no other soldiers.

data.name: Eccentric's Armor
data.description: Unusually colorful armor. Worn by the knight Jerren. Jerren preferred a nomadic existence, but after spending time as guest of the Carian royals, he became a guest commander for General Radahn. And for the first time, the restless tumbleweed would be bound by honorable oath

data.name: Eye Surcoat
data.description: Brown surcoat draped over chainmail.

data.name: Festive Garb
data.description: Ceremonial garb worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills. Faintly bloodstained.

data.name: Errant Sorcerer Robe (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Errant Sorcerer Robe.

data.name: Festive Garb (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the  Festive Garb.

data.name: Fia's Robe
data.description: Robe of black cloth that covers the entire body. Worn by Fia, the Deathbed Companion, on her journey after being exiled from her home.

data.name: Fell Omen Cloak
data.description: "A cloak of ragged fur worn about the exposed body of Margit, the Fell Omen.

data.name: Exile Armor
data.description: Damaged armor draped with a large deep-red cloth. Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.

data.name: Finger Maiden Robe (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Finger Maiden Robe.

data.name: Finger Maiden Robe
data.description: Robe worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers. The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers.

data.name: Fingerprint Armor
data.description: Iron armor singed and blistered by fingers. Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold. No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy. Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?

data.name: Fingerprint Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Fingerprint Armor.

data.name: Fur Raiment
data.description: Raiment fashioned from a bristly pelt. Worn by ancestral follower warriors. The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

data.name: Gelmir Knight Armor
data.description: Armor worn by knights once royal to Praector Rykard.

data.name: Gelmir Knight Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Gelmir Knight Armor.

data.name: Fire Prelate Armor
data.description: Black iron armor adorned with a red cloth. Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

data.name: Godrick Knight Armor
data.description: Armor worn by knights loyal to Godrick The Grafted.

data.name: Godksin Noble Robe
data.description: Robe made by sewing together patches of smooth skin. Subcutaneous fat makes it plump and soft. Worn by Godskin Nobles known for their seven-face aprons. Strengthens the Noble Presence incantation. Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unlike the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.

data.name: Fire Prelate Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Fire Prelate Armor.

data.name: Foot Soldier Tabard
data.description: Padded cloth armor with more than a few stains. Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

data.name: Fire Monk Armor
data.description: Black iron armor adorned with a red cloth. Attire of the Fire Monks.

data.name: Godrick Knight Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Godric Knight Armor.

data.name: Goldmask's Rags
data.description: Worn rags that just barely cover the body. Lord Goldmask felt no draw to the vain excess of clothing; what use is finery to one who seeks greater brilliance?

data.name: Gravekeeper Cloak
data.description: Defensive wear encircled by bronze snakes. Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes. The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.

data.name: Godskin Apostle Robe
data.description: Robe made by sewing together patches of smooth skin.

data.name: Haligtree Crest Surcoat
data.description: Armor worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree. The surcoat bears the crest of the Haligtree. Though watered with Miquella's own blood since it was a sapling, the Haligtree ultimately failed to grow into an Erdtree.

data.name: Gravekeeper Cloak (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Gravekeeper Cloak.

data.name: Guardian Garb
data.description: Engraved golden garb. Worn by guardians of the Minor Erdtree.

data.name: Haligtree Knight Armor
data.description: Armor worn by knights sworn the Haligtree.

data.name: Guardian Garb (full Bloom)
data.description: Engraved golden garb. Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees. Raises the HP recovery effects of the Flask of Crimson Tears, but greatly lowers fire damage negation. It is said that the blood-red flowers blooming on their backs mark the senescence of their ancient pact. Perhaps the guardians are part tree already

data.name: Haligtree Knight Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Haligtree Knight Armor.

data.name: High Page Clothes
data.description: Clothes of a page selected for special privileges by the noble they serve.

data.name: Highwayman Cloth Armor
data.description: Hideously stained and ragged cloth armor. Worn by former foot soldiers who have turned to banditry.

data.name: High Page Clothes (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the High Page Clothes.

data.name: Hoslow's Armor
data.description: Garish silver armor decorated with red embellishments. Passed down through the Hoslow family. When Juno Hoslow received an invitation to the Volcano Manor, he discreetly refused. "I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion."

data.name: Ivory-draped Tabard
data.description: Padded cloth armor with a shawl in the color of ivory draped over the shoulders. Worn by foot soldiers sworn to the Haligtree.

data.name: Knight Armor
data.description: Iron armor of an unknown knight. It is made of thin iron plate. Such metal armor is heavy, but provides considerable damage negation.

data.name: Juvenile Scholar Robe
data.description: Robe worn by young academy scholars, the juveniles birthed anew by the amber egg of Queen Rennala, the head of Raya Lucaria Academy. Yet their rebirth is not without imperfections, and thus do they repeat the process, eventually becoming utterly dependent upon it. Rebirth is as sleep to them, and with each awakening, memory fades into oblivion.

data.name: Kaiden Armor
data.description: Armor worn by Kaiden sellswords.

data.name: Land Of Reeds Armor
data.description: Armor made from strips of iron fastened together. Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds. The Land of Reeds has long been locked in a miserable civil war, during which time it has remained alienated from the cultures of its neighbors. Little wonder that the entire nation has succumbed to blood-soaked madness, or so it is said.

data.name: Hoslow's Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Hoslow's Armor.

data.name: Lazuli Robe
data.description: Robe worn by scholars of the Lazuli Conspectus, singular among the greater Raya Lucaria Academy. These scholars, who sought to master Carian sorcery, instead learned to see the moon as equal to the stars. This robe, in the hue of the full moon, signifies their heresy.

data.name: Leather Armor
data.description: Lightweight and battle-proven leather armor worn by a savvy soldier.

data.name: Leather-draped Tabard
data.description: Padded cloth armor with a leather shawl draped over the shoulders.

data.name: Lionel's Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Lionel's Armor.

data.name: Leyndell Knight Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Leyndell Knight Armor.

data.name: Leyndell Knight Armor
data.description: Armor worn by knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. Its left breast is emblazoned with a symbol of Erdtree Worship, said to have once been imbued with an incantation of protection.

data.name: Lionel's Armor
data.description: Round iron armor with a banner extending from its back. Worn by the Lionel the Lionhearted.

data.name: Lord Of Blood's Robe
data.description: Attire of Mohg, Lord of Blood, embroidered with an extravagant gold emblem on black cloth. The dress of a Luminary, the reigning lord and hierarch of the coming dynasty of Mohgwyn. Or perhaps, of a raving lunatic.

data.name: Lusat's Robe
data.description: A robe reserved for grand masters at the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Corroded by blue glintstones.

data.name: Lord Of Blood's Robe (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Lord Of Blood's Robe.

data.name: Malenia's Armor
data.description: Armor made of unalloyed gold. Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella. Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk. "My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god - he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."

data.name: Maliketh's Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Maliketh's Armor.

data.name: Malenia's Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Maleinia's Armor.

data.name: Malformed Dragon Armor
data.description: Malformed golden armor. Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels. After the great ancient dragon Gransax attacked, the sentinels had an epiphany. The only way to truly protect the Erdtree was to become dragons themselves.

data.name: Maliketh's Armor
data.description: Beast's armor made of black iron and decorated with gold. Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade. Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him. Champions knew what was at stake. Indeed, that is what made them champions.

data.name: Marionette Soldier Armor
data.description: Armor of metal bands arranged in a lattice. Worn by marionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers. The construction of this armor is remarkably crude, now rusted over and severely dented. For a doll, the only thing that matters is that it does not break.

data.name: Marais Robe
data.description: Robe with a black mantle across the shoulders. Customarily worn by the head of House Marais. The sons of House Marais are all sickly born. Little wonder that Maleigh Marais would be so beguiled by the beautiful and fierce goddess who was born into rot.

data.name: Mausoleum Knight Armor
data.description: Armor worn by headless knights who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum. The wing-shaped ornaments on its back evoke the Deathbird. A self-inflicted curse that ties the spirits of these loyal knights to the land, having willingly beheaded themselves so that they may serve theirs masters in death.

data.name: Mausoleum Surcoat
data.description: Armor worn by headless soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.

data.name: Mausoleum Knight Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Mausoleum Knight Armor

data.name: Mushroom Body
data.description: Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushroom have colonized the torso. To those enraptured by the scarlet rot, they are holy vestments that root one to the earth.

data.name: Nomadic Merchant's Finery (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Nomadic Merchant's Finery

data.name: Night's Cavalry Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Night's Cavalry Armor

data.name: Night's Cavalry Armor
data.description: Pitch-black armor thinly painted with dried blood. Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

data.name: Night Maiden Armor
data.description: Armor worn by the nightmaidens of the Eternal City. Indicates the highest clerical rank, and includes a silk cape. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

data.name: Nomadic Merchant's Finery
data.description: Finery of the nomadic merchants.

data.name: Noble's Traveling Garb
data.description: Traveling attire fashioned from metallic white silk thread. Worn by expatriated royalty. A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.

data.name: Nox Monk Armor
data.description: Armor worn by the monks of the Eternal City, with a silk cape attached. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

data.name: Nox Swordstress Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Nox Swordstress Armor.

data.name: Nox Monk Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Nox Monk Armor.

data.name: Nox Swordstress Armor
data.description: Armor worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City. These women are the personal guards of the nightmaidens, and wear silk capes. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

data.name: Omen Armor
data.description: Malformed armor resembling an Omen with its horns cut off.

data.name: Official's Attire
data.description: Grubby blue robe worn by magisterial officials to carry out their grim tasks. Surveillance, executions, gruesome rituals... The darkest duties drive the wheels of mankind.

data.name: Page Garb
data.description: Garb worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way.

data.name: Perfumer's Traveling Garb
data.description: Garb of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

data.name: Page Garb (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Page Garb.

data.name: Perfumer Robe
data.description: Robe of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

data.name: Perfumer's Traveling Garb (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Perfumer's Traveling Garb.

data.name: Perfumer Robe (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Perfurmer's Robe.

data.name: Omenkiller Robe
data.description: Robe worn by the Omenkillers, butchers of twisted conscience.

data.name: Old Aristocrat Gown
data.description: Gown of soft cloth adorned with fine gold embroidery. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged. Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

data.name: Preceptor's Long Gown (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Preceptor's Long Gown.

data.name: Preceptor's Long Gown
data.description: A long, bright blue gown with the movements of the stars drawn upon it. Worn by the magic preceptors who served the Carian royals. Glintstone sorcerers are the descendants of astrologers, a fact that the Carians remain aware of. Even if their fate has been long severed from the stars.

data.name: Prophet Robe (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Prophet Robe.

data.name: Queen's Robe
data.description: Robe indicating the highest order of sorcerer. Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him. And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

data.name: Prophet Robe
data.description: Robe of exiled prophets who foresaw that their faith would end in flames — and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result. Its fabric scrapes against their skin like a file, and the rickety cart wheel around the neck warns passers-by not to lend an ear to their meandering sermons.

data.name: Prisoner Clothing
data.description: Tattered clothing. Worn by a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime. Never once washed, every fiber is filthy.

data.name: Ragged Armor
data.description: Armor pieced together from scavenged metal.

data.name: Ragged Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Ragged Armor.

data.name: Radahn's Lion Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Radahn's Lion Armor.

data.name: Radahn's Lion Armor
data.description: Armor depicting the golden lion. Worn by General Radahn.

data.name: Raging Wolf Armor (altered)
data.description: Armor worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.

data.name: Raya Lucarian Robe
data.description: Robe worn by Raya Lucaria's magic scholars. Those who dedicate themselves to the study of glintstones formed from starry amber receive this modest yet elegant deep blue garb along with their vows of virtue and austerity. But with extended life, one is apt to forget old vows.

data.name: Raging Wolf Armor
data.description: Armor worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold. According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean. Vargram aspired to such a state himself.

data.name: Redmane Surcoat
data.description: Armor worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side.

data.name: Ronin's Armor
data.description: Armor of the man who calls himself Shabriri. Highly functional and heavily worn.

data.name: Rotten Gravekeeper Cloak
data.description: Thick, bristly cloak eaten through by scarlet rot. The symbol of an underground gravekeeper's station.

data.name: Redmane Knight Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Redmane Knight Armor. The armor is not as sturdy as the original, but it still provides a decent amount of protection.

data.name: Ronin's Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Ronin's Armor. The armor is not as sturdy as the original, but it still provides a decent amount of protection.

data.name: Redmane Knight Armor
data.description: Armor worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side.

data.name: Raptor's Black Feathers
data.description: Robe crafted with the black feathers of a bird of prey. Worn by the assassin Ravenmount.

data.name: Royal Knight Armor
data.description: Silver armor of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree. Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

data.name: Royal Knight Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Royal Knight Armor. The armor is not as sturdy as the original, but it still provides a decent amount of protection.

data.name: Rotten Gravekeeper Cloak (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Rotten Gravekeeper Cloak.

data.name: Royal Remains Armor
data.description: Armory graces with gold human bones. Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

data.name: Scaled Armor
data.description: Armor worn by Old Knight Istvan. The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it high effective against non-physical attacks.

data.name: Sanguine Noble Robe
data.description: Robe of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery. Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood. The grand metallic pattern on the shoulder is a signifier of the noble rank they intend to claim upon the advent of the new dynasty they are working to install.

data.name: Ruler's Robe
data.description: Luxurious robe worn by lords in a smaller nation. Its fine blue mantle serves to prove its wearer's status.

data.name: Scaled Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Scaled Armor

data.name: Sage Robe
data.description: Thick burgundy robe. Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical. Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.

data.name: Scale Armor
data.description: Armor reinforced with small metal scales. The cape covering the shoulders is made with treated rock lizard skin, and provides ample protection against fire.

data.name: Traveling Maiden Robe (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Traveling Maiden Robe

data.name: Snow Witch Robe (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Snow Witch Robe

data.name: Scarlet Tabard
data.description: Padded cloth armor with the telltale stains of the scarlet rot. Worn by foot soldiers in General Radahn's army

data.name: Shaman Furs
data.description: Raiment fashioned from a bristly pelt. Worn by ancestral follower shamans.

data.name: Traveling Maiden Robe
data.description: Robe worn by traveling maidens. Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.

data.name: Snow Witch Robe
data.description: Witch's robe in the color of snow. Once worn by the snowy crone who the young Ranni encountered deep in the woods. She was a witch, and well versed in cold sorceries. It is said that the doll that houses Ranni's soul was modeled after her. That old witch was Ranni's secret mentor.

data.name: Tree Sentinel Armor
data.description: Golden armor of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

data.name: Spellblade's Traveling Attire (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Spellblade's Traveling Attire

data.name: Traveler's Clothes
data.description: Light yet sturdy clothes.

data.name: Spellblade's Traveling Attire
data.description: Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's traveling attire, graced with an intricate, aristocratic decoration. Strengthens glintstone sorcery skills.

data.name: Tree Sentinel Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Tree Sentinel Armor

data.name: Twinned Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Twinned Armor

data.name: Vagabond Knight Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Vagabond Knight Armor

data.name: Vagabond Knight Armor
data.description: Chest piece of a knight banished from their motherland.  Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.

data.name: Veteran's Armor
data.description: Old armor that has seen many battles. Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol. Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master. This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.

data.name: Twinned Armor
data.description: Armor depicting entwined twins of gold and silver.

data.name: Veteran's Armor (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Veteran's Armor

data.name: Tree Surcoat
data.description: Blue surcoat draped over chainmail. The tree insignia emblazoned on the front depicts the Erdtree, and is a design beloved throughout the Lands Between.

data.name: Upper-class Robe
data.description: Embroidered, bright green robe worn by noble children. Donning such a robe is traditionally the child's first show of burgeoning independence.

data.name: Tree-and-beast Surcoat
data.description: Armor worn by soldiers loyal to Godrick the Grafted. The surcoat depicts the distant Erdtree and the beast regent, an emblem of the golden lineage. Both are symbols of glory now past.

data.name: Vulgar Militia Armor
data.description: Armor worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.

data.name: White Reed Armor
data.description: Armor of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates. Worn by the Inabam head disciples of the great swordsman Okina.

data.name: War Surgeon Gown
data.description: "Bloodstained white gown of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers. Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood none were able to tame the accursed blood. None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception."

data.name: War Surgeon Gown (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the War Surgeon Gown.

data.name: Azur's Manchettes
data.description: Manchettes corroded by blue-green glintstones. Worn by Azur, primeval current sorcerer.

data.name: Battlemage Manchettes
data.description: Manchettes worn by scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy, tattered from being worn on the battlefield.

data.name: Astrologer Gloves
data.description: Gloves fashioned from fine, supple cloth. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above. They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers. But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

data.name: Bandit Manchettes
data.description: Manchettes made by simple wrapping dirty cloth around the arms. Worn by bandits.

data.name: Banished Knight Gauntlets
data.description: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. These gauntlets were worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

data.name: Zamor Armor
data.description: Armor worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants. These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.

data.name: Alberich's Bracers
data.description: Mad Tongue Alberich's bracers.

data.name: Beast Champion Gauntlets
data.description: Silver gauntlets engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant. Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was. Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

data.name: Black Knife Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets used by the Black Knife Assassins. Crafted with scale armor that makes no sound. The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

data.name: Blackflame Monk Gauntlets
data.description: Black iron gauntlets featuring a flame motif. Attire of the Blackflame Monks.

data.name: Blaidd's Gauntlets
data.description: Well-worn black gauntlets of the man-wolf Blaidd.

data.name: Brave's Bracer
data.description: Gauntlets wrapped in thick leather. Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands. Has a fur lining which excels at keeping the cold at bay.

data.name: Briar Gauntlets
data.description: Battered iron gauntlets from a foreign land. Worn by Elemer of the Briar.

data.name: Bull-goat Gauntlets
data.description: Great Horned Tragoth's gauntlets. Covers its wearer with a pair of giant horns, providing staunch poise.

data.name: Bloodsoaked Manchettes
data.description: Manchettes formed from tightly-wound bandages soaked through with blood. Any protection is welcome for the festering arms beneath.

data.name: Bloodhound Knight Gauntlets
data.description: Metal gauntlets of the Bloodhound Knights.

data.name: Blue Silver Bracelets
data.description: Bracelets crafted with blue silver. Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers.

data.name: Carian Knight Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family. The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen,  were heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.

data.name: Chain Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets made of woven chain. Standard issue for ordinary soldiers. Though plain in appearance, they offer dependable protection.

data.name: Cuckoo Knight Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights. Time has yet to dull their luster.

data.name: Confessor Gloves
data.description: Black leather gloves of the church confessors. The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace. The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

data.name: Cleanrot Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering. The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles fiercest of all.

data.name: Champion Bracers
data.description: Bracers reserved for the bandlands' bravest.  Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes.  Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

data.name: Depraved Perfumer Gloves
data.description: Gloves worn by depraved perfumers.

data.name: Champion Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets reserved for the badlands' bravest. Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes. Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

data.name: Elden Lord Bracers
data.description: Bracers of Godfrey the first Elden Lord. The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield. He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

data.name: Eccentric's Manchettes
data.description: The knight Jerren's manchettes. Jerren preferred a nomadic existence, but after spending time as a guest of the Carian royals, he became the guest commander for General Radahn. And for the first time, the restless tumbleweed would be bound by honorable oath.

data.name: Drake Knight Gauntlets
data.description: Black iron gauntlets worn by drake knights. Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion. From birth, drake knights speak not a word. They spend their lives pursuing the strength of dragons, for its sublime beauty and inspiration of awe

data.name: Crucible Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. Hold the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthen Aspects of the Crucible incantations. In time, the strength shown by these knights, and even their appearance, was seen as chaotic and deserving of scorn.

data.name: Errant Sorcerer Manchettes
data.description: Commonplace leather manchettes. Their hands are inlaid with dulled glintstone.

data.name: Fire Monk Gauntlets
data.description: Black iron gauntlets featuring a flame motif. Attire of the Fire Monks.

data.name: Godrick Knight Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets worn by knights loyal to Godrick the Grafted. Time has yet to dull their luster.

data.name: Gelmir Knight Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets worn by knights once loyal to Praetor Rykard. Time has yet to dull their luster.

data.name: Foot Soldier Gauntlets
data.description: Metal gauntlets covered in nicks and dents. Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

data.name: Exile Gauntlets
data.description: Damaged iron gauntlets. Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.

data.name: Fingerprint Gauntlets
data.description: Iron gauntlets singed and blistered by fingers. Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold. No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy. Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?

data.name: Godrick Soldier Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets worn by soldiers loyal to Godrick the Grafted. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

data.name: Fire Prelate Gauntlets
data.description: Black iron gauntlets with the appearance of flames. Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

data.name: Godskin Apostle Bracelets
data.description: Black bracelets of the Godskin Apostles.

data.name: Highwayman Gauntlets
data.description: Hideously stained and dented gauntlets. Worn by former foot soldiers who have turned to banditry.

data.name: Godskin Noble Bracelets
data.description: Black bracelets of the Godskin Nobles. Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unlike the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.

data.name: Haligtree Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

data.name: Haligtree Knight Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets worn by knights sworn to the Haligtree. Time has yet to dull their luster.

data.name: Hoslow's Gauntlets
data.description: Garish silver gauntlets decorated with red embellishments. Passed down through the Hoslow family.

data.name: Kaiden Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets worn by Kaiden sellswords.

data.name: Iron Gauntlets
data.description: Ordinary iron gauntlets.

data.name: Gold Bracelets
data.description: Bracelets made in the image of Erdtree branches. Minimal adornments made my Lord Goldmask's disciples. Those disciples have long since left him.

data.name: Guardian Bracers
data.description: Engraved golden bracers. Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtree.

data.name: Golden Prosthetic
data.description: Golden prosthetic forged using ancient techniques

data.name: Knight Gauntlets
data.description: Iron gauntlets of an unknown knight. It is made of thin iron plate. Such metal armor is heavy, but provides considerable damage negation.

data.name: Land Of Reeds Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets wrapped in tough leather. Worn by the warriors of the Land of Reeds

data.name: Lusat's Manchettes
data.description: Manchettes corroded by blue glintstones. Worn by Lusat, primeval current sorcerer.

data.name: Maliketh's Gauntlets
data.description: Beast's gauntlets made of black iron and decorated with gold. Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade. Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyral half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him. Champions knew what was at stake. Indeed, that is what made them champions

data.name: Leyndell Soldier Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets worn by soldiers sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

data.name: Leather Gloves
data.description: Lightweight and battle-proven leather gloves worn by a savvy soldier. Many admire the wearer of this armor for his chivalrous and forthright spirit.

data.name: Lionel's Gauntlets
data.description: Founded iron gauntlets.

data.name: Malenia's Gauntlet
data.description: Gauntlet made of unalloyed gold. Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella. Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk. "My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god—he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."

data.name: Malformed Dragon Gauntlets
data.description: Malformed golden gauntlets.

data.name: Leyndell Knight Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets worn by knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. Time has yet to dull their luster

data.name: Omen Gauntlets
data.description: Malformed Gauntlets resembling an Omen with its horns cut off.

data.name: Mushroom Arms
data.description: Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushroom have colonized the arms.

data.name: Mausoleum Knight Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets worn by headless knights who endlessly guard the Walking Mausoleum. Time has yet to dull their luster.

data.name: Mausoleum Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets worn by headless soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

data.name: Millicent's Gloves
data.description: Gloves worn by Millicent the Rotting

data.name: Nox Monk Bracelets
data.description: Bracelets worn by the monks of the Eternal City. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

data.name: Noble's Gloves
data.description: Gloves of plush leather. Worn by expatriated royalty. A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.

data.name: Perfumer Gloves
data.description: Gloves of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

data.name: Night's Cavalry Gauntlets
data.description: Pitch-black gauntlets thinly painted with dried blood. Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

data.name: Omenkiller Long Gloves
data.description: Long,stiff leather gloves worn by the Omenkillers.

data.name: Preceptor's Gloves
data.description: Trousers of the magic preceptors who serve the Carian royals. Black and perfectly discreet.

data.name: Raya Lucarian Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

data.name: Ragged Gloves
data.description: Gauntlets pieced together from scavenged metal.

data.name: Radahn Soldier Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

data.name: Radahn's Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets depicting the golden lion. Worn by General Radahn.

data.name: Royal Knight Gauntlets
data.description: Silver gauntlets of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree. Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

data.name: Ronin's Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets of the man who calls himself Shabriri. Highly functional and heavily worn.

data.name: Queen's Bracelets
data.description: Bracelets indicating the highest order of sorcerer. Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him. And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

data.name: Royal Remains Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets graces with gold human bones. Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

data.name: Traveler's Gloves
data.description: Gloves of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

data.name: Tree Sentinel Gauntlets
data.description: Golden gauntlets of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

data.name: Traveler's Manchettes
data.description: Light yet sturdy leather manchettes.

data.name: Sorcerer Manchettes
data.description: Manchettes worn by Raya Lucaria's magic scholars. Made by wrapping a simple cloth around the forearms.

data.name: Twinned Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets depicting entwined twins of gold and silver.

data.name: Traveling Maiden Gloves
data.description: Gloves worn by traveling maidens.

data.name: Vagabond Knight Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets of a knight banished form their motherland. Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey. Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.

data.name: Veteran's Gauntlets
data.description: Old gauntlets that has seen many battles. Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol.

data.name: Scaled Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets worn by Old Knight Istvan. The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it high effective against non-physical attacks. Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survived to this day.

data.name: Spellblade's Gloves
data.description: Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's traveling attire, graced with an intricate, aristocratic decoration. Strengthens glintstone sorcery skills.

data.name: Vulgar Militia Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.

data.name: Aristocrat Hat
data.description: Leather hat decorated with a withered feather. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital, and the belonging of a family which claims a knight as an ancestor.

data.name: Warrior Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets of a nomadic warrior. Crafted from sturdy leather.

data.name: Aristocrat Headband
data.description: Valuable headband featuring fine goldwork.

data.name: Alberich's Pointed Hat (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Alberich's Pointed Hat.

data.name: Alberich's Pointed Hat
data.description: Mad Tongue Alberich's pointed hat, a sign of a heretical practitioner.

data.name: War Surgeon Gloves
data.description: Bloodstained white gloves of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers. Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood none were able to tame the accursed blood. None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception

data.name: Zamor Bracelets
data.description: Bracelets worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants. These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.

data.name: White Reed Gauntlets
data.description: Gauntlets of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates. Worn by the Inabam head disciples of the great swordsman Okina. The Inaba traveled in pursuit of not only the master who abandoned them, but also proper deaths, won honorably through hard-fought combat. To be a White Reed is to seek death; fitting for the Inaba, who desired nothingmore than to die by the sword.

data.name: Bandit Mask
data.description: Mask of black cloth that covers the mouth. Favored by bandits for hiding their faces, it also provides some protection against poison.

data.name: Black Dumpling
data.description: Mask forced on a victim's head to lend torture an extra degree of cruelty. It magnifies one's fears and make them acutely aware of all forms of pain Raises attack power when the wearer suffers from madness. When the Black Dumpling goes on, the torturer no longer seeks answers; only to inflict suffering without hope of relief.

data.name: Banished Knight Helm (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Banished Knight Helm

data.name: Ash-of-war Scarab
data.description: Gray scarab worn directly on the head.

data.name: Astrologer Hood
data.description: Hood fashioned from supple cloth. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above. They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers. But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

data.name: Black Hood
data.description: Hood of lusterless black fabric that conceals its wearer's identity.

data.name: Azur's Glintstone Crown
data.description: Crown of Azur, primeval current sorcerer, set with a prominent blue-green glintstone.

data.name: Banished Knight Helm
data.description: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. This helm was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

data.name: Beast Champion Helm
data.description: Silver helm engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.

data.name: Black Wolf Mask
data.description: A mask fashioned after the head of a black wolf.

data.name: Bloodsoaked Mask
data.description: Mask formed from tightly-wound bandages soaked through with blood. Even the most ghastly cover is more inviting than the festering face beneath.

data.name: Black Knife Hood
data.description: Hood used by the Black Knife Assassins. The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be N u men who had close ties with Marika herself.

data.name: Blue Silver Mail Hood
data.description: Chainmail hood crafted with blue silver. Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers.

data.name: Bloodhound Knight Helm
data.description: Metal helm with a pointed beak. Worn by the Bloodhound Knights. The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers. Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master. Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

data.name: Blackguard's Iron Mask
data.description: Iron mask forced on convicted prisoners. Worn by the blackguard Big Boggart. To Boggart, the mask made him all the more threatening, and helped him get what he wanted. But it was also a mirror of his emptiness.

data.name: Blue Festive Hood
data.description: Hood worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills. Use of this hood, dyed in a stunning blue, is only permitted for the young maids who play the central role in the festival.

data.name: Blackflame Monk Hood
data.description: Mail hood of iron links covering a headband engraved with black flames.

data.name: Blue Cloth Cowl
data.description: Cowl of a nomadic warrior. The blue color of its fabric symbolizes brisk waters, as fluid and flowing as the sword in the hand of its wearer. Just as still waters turn foul, stagnation leads to decay. Warriors must remain ever-drifting.

data.name: Champion Headband
data.description: Headband reserved for the badlands' bravest. Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes. Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

data.name: Chain Coif
data.description: Coif made of woven chain. Standard issue for ordinary soldiers. Though plain in appearance, it offers dependable protection.

data.name: Bull-goat Helm
data.description: Great Horned Tragoth's helm, adorned with a gold bull-goat motif. Provides high poise.

data.name: Brave's Cord Circlet
data.description: Warrior's headband of woven leather. Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands. The small flags, white cloths and sheaves of wheat often found hung from these headbands are prayers of farewell from the people of their home. In bidding farewell t warriors departing on a journey from which they aren't like to return, this small act offers only meager relief.

data.name: Cerulean Tear Scarab
data.description: Blue scarab worn directly on the head. These scarabs roll clumps of cerulean tears during their labors.

data.name: Cleanrot Helm
data.description: Winged helm of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering.

data.name: Carian Knight Helm
data.description: Helm of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family. The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.

data.name: Briar Helm
data.description: Battered iron helm from a foreign land. Worn by Elemer of he Brair.

data.name: Brave's Leather Helm
data.description: Battlewear wrapped in thick leather. Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.

data.name: Cleanrot Helm (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Cleanrot Helm

data.name: Confessor Hood
data.description: Black hood for blending in with the darkness. Worn by church confessors. The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace. The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

data.name: Commoner's Headband (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Commoner's Headband

data.name: Confessor Hood (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Confessor Hood

data.name: Commoner's Headband
data.description: A headband with the cloth removed. Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

data.name: Consort's Mask
data.description: Mask worn by Tanith, Lady of the Volcano Manor, in the image of a foreign queen.

data.name: Crucible Axe Helm
data.description: Helm of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. The axe ornamentation is the knight Ordovis's mark, displayed also by his men. Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

data.name: Crimson Hood
data.description: A hooded cloak of vivid crimson.  Worn by expatriates royalty.  Increases vigor.

data.name: Crimson Tear Scarab
data.description: Red scarab worn directly on the head. The red scarabs roll clumps of crimson tears during their labors.

data.name: Crucible Tree Helm
data.description: Helm of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. The great tree ornamentation is the knight Siluria's mark, displayed also by her men. Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

data.name: Diallos's Mask
data.description: Replica of a twin-tailed silver helm with flowery adornments. Only, without the twin tails.

data.name: Drake Knight Helm (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Drake Knight Helm.

data.name: Depraved Perfumer Headscarf
data.description: Headscarf worn by depraved perfumers.

data.name: Cuckoo Knight Helm
data.description: Helm worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights. Its brow is adorned with a single cuckoo's feather.

data.name: Duelist Helm
data.description: Bronze helm decorated with innumerable snakes. Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes. The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.

data.name: Eccentric's Hood
data.description: A pointy, ragged hood. Worn by the knight Jerren. The hood hides an aged, bearded mask. Jerren served General Radahn as a guest commander, and they are said to have sworn an oath of honorable death to one another.

data.name: Drake Knight Helm
data.description: Black iron helm worn by drake knights. Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion. From birth, drake knights speak not a word. They spend their lives pursuing the strength of dragons, for its sublime beauty and inspiration of awe

data.name: Eccentric's Hood (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Eccentric's Hood

data.name: Elden Lord Crown
data.description: Crown of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield. He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

data.name: Envoy Crown
data.description: The soft bundle worn on the head by Oracle Envoys. Densely wrapped in several layers of cloth. Raises the potency of bubble-based skills. No one knows what the cloth hides, but some claim to have heard a faint whimpering from inside. It must have been their imagination.

data.name: Exile Hood
data.description: Deep red hood that covers the whole head. Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies, who were required to keep their faces hidden.

data.name: Festive Hood (altered)
data.description: Lighter version of the Festive Hood

data.name: Festive Hood
data.description: Hood worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills. Decorated with many-colored flowers.

data.name: Finger Maiden Fillet
data.description: Fillet worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers. The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers. The guidance of grace would ensure that the pair be brought together. Or at least, such was the promise long ago.

data.name: Fire Monk Hood
