data.description: Empty ashes of war, devoid of any memories of battle.Unable to apply any kind of affinity in their current state, but can be used by Smithing Master Hewg of the Roundtable Hold to recreate other ashes.Thus does the copy pass into becoming the genuine article.

The fell god still lurks within the Fire Giants.

The fundamentalists describe the Golden Order through the powers of regression and causality. Regression is the pull of meaning; that all things yearn eternally to converge.

data.description: One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists. Used by hunters of Those Who Live in Death. Enchants armament held in the right hand with holy-affinity attacks. This incantation is especially damaging to Those Who Live in Death. Any felled by this incantation cannot be revived. The role of the hunters is to stamp out defiled reason - all for the perfection of the Golden Order.

data.name: Magic Fortification
data.description: Incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful. Increases magic damage negation. This incantation can be cast while in motion. Follow the path that has been set for you, and you will make enemies of all others: the monks, the sorcerers, the ancient dragon knights, and the scions of gold. Heed me – the Lands Between offers no welcome to the Tarnished.

Hold to continue praying and delay activation. In the beginning, everything was in opposition to the Erdtree. But through countless victories in war, it became the embodiment of Order.

Those who dwell within poison know rot all too well. The death that begets life, that comes to all equally. That is to say: it is the cycle of rebirth put into practice.

The new palace of the Lord of Blood lies in a swamp of festering blood, and these flies are said to spawn from excrement in that land.

Allows one follow-up attack. The name of the ancient troll warrior Theodorix lives on — as a hero of the War against the Giants.

This incantation can be used while in motion. It is the maddening pain and unstoppable tears of those afflicted with the flame of frenzy brought into being.

data.description: One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists. Produces three rings of light and fires them forwards. The rings of light return to a position close to the caster before disappearing. This incantation can be cast repeatedly. A gift from the young Ivliquella to his father, Radagon.

data.name: Bridge Of Sacrifice
data.description: A busy bridge swarming with iron-clad foes. Be prepared to engage in an array of melee, ranged and artillery attacks or attempt to push past them

data.name: Church Of Elleh
data.description: Church of Elleh is a ruined building that hides a Site of Grace. The rooftop has caved in and offers no protection from the elements, and weeds are overtaking the walls, but this doesn't stop merchants from seeking what little shelter is on offer

data.name: Deathtouched Catacombs
data.description: Catacombs filled with the stench of death, Skeletons dwell in the shadows

data.name: Church Of Dragon Communion
data.description: The dilapidated remains of the Church of Dragon Communion showcase the ruin that came to the land. But could a flame still linger at its altar??

data.name: Coastal Cave
data.description: Coastal Cave is a dark opening on the side of a cliff. Its mossy depths are overrun by hostile humanoid creatures, but those who brave it may find passage to new lands

data.name: Dragon-burnt Ruins
data.description: Dragon-Burnt Ruins are what remains of the housing area among Agheel Lake, long lost to the deadly attacks of the fierce Agheel Dragon

data.name: Forlorn Hound Evergaol
data.description: The southern Evergaol of Limgrave, before the entrance to Weeping Peninsula

data.name: Fringefolk Hero's Grave
data.description: Fingefolk Hero's Grave is a dark and secluded location within the Cave of Knowledge. The confused and aimless dwell within

data.name: Fort Haight
data.description: The overrun fort of Kenneth Haith, the alleged next ruler of Limgrave

data.name: Divine Tower Of Limgrave
data.description: Closed with a giant set of doors. It looks like you need some pieces to interact with the tower.

data.name: Gatefront Ruins
data.description: Gatefront Ruins is what remains of the now destroyed barracks near the fortification. Despite its poor state, it is a heavily guarded location by those loyal to Stormveil

data.name: Limgrave Tunnels
data.description: Limgrave Tunnels are a mine harvested for Glimstone. Its zealous miners don't dare venture into its hidden chambers, for fear of the hoarder Troll within

data.name: Groveside Cave
data.description: Groveside Cave is a small refuge for wildlife in Limgrave. Its proximity to water and ease of access make it a sought-after shelter against bad weather, but those who venture in don't seem to return

data.name: Minor Erdtree (mistwood)
data.description: Easily distiguished from the rest of the trees in Mistwood Forest.

data.name: Highroad Cave
data.description: A cave that houses a tomb, deep within. It is situated at the northmost part of Limgrave. It has been inhabited by a pack of Wolves, Land Octopuses, and Giant Bats

data.name: Mistwood
data.description: Mistwood is a Location in Elden Ring. The Mistwood region is located in the Eastern part of Limgrave. Tiered terrain, small beaches, and luscious forests occupied by Lesser Runebears are the defining features of this region.

data.name: Mistwood Ruins
data.description: Concealed by the thriving growth of vegetation, these ruins are kept out of sight by the veil of nature itself. But there's more to it than what you see

data.name: Murkwater Catacombs
data.description: An underground cemetery that is located at the north-east side of Agheel Lake in Limgrave. Once a place for peaceful rest for fallen heroes, it is now infested by goblins.

data.name: Murkwater Cave
data.description: A dark cave halfway through the Murkwater River

data.name: Siofra River Well
data.description: A mystical underground region filled with its own set of skies and stars. Beware, it is teeming with creatures big and small alike

data.name: Smoldering Church
data.description: The Last Church in Limgrave before reaching Caelid

data.name: Stormgate
data.description: The Stormgate is a heavily guarded area that marks the border within Limgrave and Stormhill. Only the foolhardy would rush such against such odds

data.name: Stormfoot Catacombs
data.description: Stormfoot Catacombs were meant as a restful place for the deceased, but its now overrun by Goblins. Its deepest secrets are secured by the Guardian of the Burial Tree

data.name: Stormhill
data.description: Stormhill is a Location in Elden Ring. Stormhill is the upper half area of Limgrave, between its central river and Stormveil.

data.name: Stormhill Evergaol
data.description: The Brave and Foolish alike dare venture into the Stormhill Evergaol and face its relentless knight in battle

data.name: Stormhill Shack
data.description: The Stormhill Shack is a dilapidated shelter formerly used to house hunters in the area. A Site of Grace offers a needed moment of rest for those traveling nearby

data.name: Stranded Graveyard
data.description: Stranded Graveyard is a dark and secluded location within the Cave of Knowledge. The confused and aimless dwell within

data.name: Summonwater Village
data.description: D, Hunter of The Dead, warns you of this nearby village taken over by death, known as Summonwater Village

data.name: Third Church Of Marika
data.description: The Ruins of an Old Church found in the Mistwood. The most prominent sight here is a statue of a lady with her arms outstretched

data.name: Warmaster's Shack
data.description: Small shack in a remote area near north-central Stormhill.

data.name: Waypoint Ruins
data.description: Waypoint Ruins consists of a group of broken buildings and abandoned campsites, now overrun with poisonous flowers and their crazed caretaker

data.name: Ailing Village
data.description: A small, abandoned village nestled within a forested area north of the Castle Morne Rampart. This village is host to long-dilapidated dwellings, inhabited only by hostile Demi-humans.

data.name: Bridge Of Sacrifice
data.description: A busy bridge swarming with iron-clad foes. Be prepared to engage in an array of melee, ranged and artillery attacks or attempt to push past them

data.name: Callu Baptismal Church
data.description: A dilapidated church, presumably frequented by the former residents of Ailing Village. Now it lies in ruin, its congregation replaced by a family of mutant vermin feasting on the remains of  unfortunate travelers

data.name: Church Of Pilgrimage
data.description: The Church of Pilgrimage is a broken building situated at the top of the cliff in the north of the Weeping Peninsula. Even with the walls and roof destroyed pilgrims still make the journey to visit this church

data.name: Castle Morne
data.description: Remants of a chaos swept castle, teeming with iron-clad enemies -now engulfed with fire, piles of remains and ruin.

data.name: Demi-human Forest Ruins
data.description: Demi-Humans congregate here to worship their queen. Defeating her will reward players with the Demi-Human Queen's Staff, which is excellent for beginner mages.

data.name: Earthbore Cave
data.description: Earthbore Cave is a small dark cave on the side of the Cliffside between Limgrave and Weeping Peninsula. One might be able to hear the squeaks of rats and the snoring of a large beast deep within if you listen closely

data.name: Forest Lookout Tower
data.description: A run-down tower built on the edge of the cliffs of the Weeping Peninsula, located west of the Bridge of Sacrifice.

data.name: Impaler's Catacombs
data.description: The Impaler's Catacombs are found in the east side of the Weeping Peninsula. Once used to store the bodies of the dead, it is now crawling with Imps.

data.name: Fourth Church Of Marika
data.description: The ruins of a lonely church, sitting atop a plateau west of the peninsula. Despite its current state, the altar remains intact and ghostly knights still roam the fields nearby, perhaps restless and duty-bound to safeguarding the area...

data.name: Minor Erdtree (weeping Peninsula)
data.description: One of the large Erdtree's found in the Weeping Peninsula. An Erdtree Avatar charges at those who approach

data.name: Isolated Merchant's Shack
data.description: Found at the western edge of the Weeping Peninsula, this lonesome hut is home to but a single person who has long adapted to a life of seclusion

data.name: Oridys's Rise
data.description: A lone observation tower atop a plateau in the east of the Weeping Peninsula. Long since abandoned, the entrance is barred by a seal, presenting travelers with a small challenge

data.name: Morne Tunnel
data.description: A dark and hidden tunnel that is inhabited by Misbegottens and Miners.

data.name: Tombsward Cave
data.description: Hidden cave in the forest teeming with poison-filled creatures.

data.name: Tombsward Ruins
data.description: The ruins of a former burial ground. Next to nothing remains here, yet squires still roam the dark tunnels beneath. Perhaps protecting the graves of their former noble masters..

data.name: Tombsward Catacombs
data.description: The Tombsward Catacombs are hidden inside the mountain near the Minor Erdtree in the Weeping Peninsula. Once filled with the bodies of the dead, armed skeletons now rise to chase away those that wish to explore its depths.

data.name: Tower Of Return
data.description: A dilapidated tower guarded by foot soldiers and mounted cavalry. Makeshift wooden platforms and ladders line the inside of the tower, allowing it to retain some function as a lookout point and a mount for ballistae

data.name: Weeping Evergaol
data.description: An evergaol located on the western landmass of the Weeping Peninsula. A formidable opponent is imprisoned within

data.name: Witchbane Ruins
data.description: A set of ruins found in western Weeping Peninsula. Overgrown with thick shrubs and poisonous flowers, this decrepit landmark invites only misery and dread.

data.name: Academy Crystal Cave
data.description: The depths of the Raya Lucaria Academy are rich in rose-tinted crystals, imbued with the natural magic of the area

data.name: Academy Gate Town
data.description: The sunken remains of the academy town

data.name: Ainsel River Well
data.description: A small structure housing a lift that takes you down to the Ainsel River.

data.name: Artist's Shack
data.description: A small cabin at North Liurnia of The Lakes. Its strongly perceived tranquility seems overshadowed by oblivion.

data.name: Bellum Church
data.description: Located past the ruins and the forested area guarded by Mounted Knights.

data.name: Bellum Highway
data.description: Outside the East Raya Lucaria Gate

data.name: Black Knife Catacombs
data.description: Black Knife Catacombs homes many skeletons and crabs within its depths, find and defeat the Black Knife Assassin within to obtain their dagger.

data.name: Caria Manor
data.description: A large estate situated far to the north of Liurnia.

data.name: Boilprawn Shack
data.description: Small cozy shack where Blackguard Big Boggart resides.

data.name: Carian Study Hall
data.description: A large library-like location full of spectres

data.name: Chapel Of Anticipation
data.description: A small starting building with trail leading to an area occupied by a gnarly Grafted Scion

data.name: Chelona's Rise
data.description: A tower overlooking the southern-most tip of Liurnia of the lakes

data.name: Church Of Inhibition
data.description: The remnants of an old church in the north of Liurnia, just before the Altus Plateau.

data.name: Cathedral Of Manus Celes
data.description: A large church atop the southern plateau of Liurnia.

data.name: Church Of Irith
data.Liurnia of the Lakes: A peaceful church at the back of Stormveil Castle.

data.name: Church Of Vows
data.description: It is here, at the Church of Vows, that the great houses of the Erdtree and the Moon were joined by the matrimonial bond between red-haired Radagon and Rennala of the Full Moon. That is why it holds in view the monuments of both houses, the Erdtree of the Capital and the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

data.name: Converted Fringe Tower
data.description: A tower found on the fringe in the northeastern tip of Liurnia.

data.name: Converted Tower
data.description: An abandoned tower

data.name: Cuckoo's Evergaol
data.description: Evergaol located on the western landmass of Liurnia. A powerful force stirs within.

data.name: Deep Ainsel Well
data.description: A deep well leading to the Moonlight Altar from the underground Grand Cloister.

data.name: Divine Tower Of Liurnia
data.description: Divine Tower of Liurnia is a Location in Elden Ring. The Divine Tower of Liurnia is found in Liurnia of the Lakes and is reached by taking the lift down at the secret area of Carian Study Hall.

data.name: Frenzied Flame Village
data.description: A village in Liurnia gripped in the madness of Three Fingers. Its denizens know nothing but the fiery frenzy burning within them

data.name: Grand Lift Of Dectus
data.description: A massive lift platform found between Liurnia and the Altus Plateau. The mechanism that operates the lift is barred by four Guardian Statues, requiring the brandishing of a special artifact for them to release their hold

data.name: Highway Lookout Tower
data.description: A lone tower overlooking the Liurnia main road on the eastern landmass

data.name: Jarburg
data.description: Jarburg was a peaceful village, but the effects of the Shattering affected even the otherwise amicable Living Jar

data.name: Kingsrealm Ruins
data.description: A ruined area, only seemingly bare.

data.name: Lakeside Crystal Cave
data.description: Hidden on the southwestern cliffs of Liurnia of the Lakes, a winding cave carved by large crystals

data.name: Laskyar Ruins
data.description: Ruins of a sunken structure beset by fog, found amidst the marshes of south Liurnia.

data.name: Lunar Estate Ruins
data.description: The ruins of a large estate found atop the southwestern plateau of Liurnia.

data.name: Malefactor's Evergaol
data.description: An evergaol overlooking the vast lakes. An ever burning flame resides within

data.name: Minor Erdtree (liurnia Southwest)
data.Liurnia of the Lakes: This ancient Erdtree overlooks the lakes from the southwest

data.name: Moonfolk Ruins
data.description: Ruins found in the southwest of the Liurnia of the Lakes region

data.name: Purified Ruins
data.description: The holy remains now lie in ruin

data.name: Ranni's Rise
data.description: A tower beset by large chunks of glintstone emerging from the ground and penetrating its interiors. Home to a mysterious figure observing The Lands Between

data.name: Raya Lucaria Crystal Tunnel
data.description: One of the vast networks of tunnels used prominently for the academy's crystal mining operation.

data.name: Renna's Rise
data.description: A Tower of the Three Sisters, belonging to Renna. It houses Ranni's Snow Witch Armor Set

data.name: Revenger's Shack
data.description: An isolated shack north of the Minor Erdtree. Bodies litter the ground inside the shack, possibly belonging to those one has taken revenge upon

data.name: Ringleader's Evergaol
data.description: An evergaol where a nortorious assassin is incarcerated

data.name: Road's End Catacombs
data.description: Catacombs at the end of the world..

data.name: Rose Church
data.description: The ruins of a former church aptly named Rose Church, for its walls are now festering with scarlet rot and overgrown with bloodroses.

data.name: Royal Grave Evergaol
data.description: An evergaol constructed for the Carian Royal family in the plains east of the royal estate

data.name: Ruin-strewn Precipice
data.description: A steep precipice with abundant caves in the insides all the way through

data.name: Seluvis's Rise
data.description: A tower bequeathed unto Preceptor Seluvis. Serves as his personal study as he delves into the sorcerous arts.

data.name: Slumbering Wolf's Shack
data.description: A small shack nestled at the side of a cliff, only accessible through a long winding cave system.   A woman and her wolf companion rest here.

data.name: Stillwater Cave
data.description: A dark and murky cave beset by a poisonous miasma. Home to servants of rot, relishing in the presence of the giant poisonblooms endemic to the cave

data.name: Temple Quarter
data.description: Ruined by the breaking, the Temple Quarter is now overrun with dangerous creatures, ready to attack any who come near

data.name: Testu's Rise
data.description: An observation tower found in the middle of a lone isle in Liurnia. The entrance is sealed by impish magic and presents a challenge to would-be visitors

data.name: The Four Belfries
data.description: As its name suggests, The Four Belfries is a hill with four large bell towers overlooking Liurnia from the west. Each belfry hosts a waygate that transports travelers to various locations

data.name: Village Of The Albinaurics
data.description: The cursemongers have destroyed the Village of the Albinaurics, but perhaps their hope to reach the promised city is not yet lost

data.name: Abandoned Cave
data.description: Long time abandoned cave.

data.name: Caelem Ruins
data.description: A set of perpetually burning ruins in western Caelid. The Caelid Highway cuts through these ruins which are heavily guarded by mobile flamethrowers and swarming with burning reanimated corpses

data.name: Caelid Catacombs
data.description: A labyrinth of Scarlet Rot-soaked floors and tunnels.

data.name: Caelid Waypoint Ruins
data.description: A set of ruins found in southwest Caelid, along the highway. Long abandoned, the ruins have become home to all manner of creatures that revel in the decay and putrefaction brought on by the scarlet rot

data.name: Aeonia Swamp
data.description: The Swamp of Aeonia is nestled in the center of the Caelid region. What were once flourishing plains filled with rich flora and fauna are now reduced to a cesspool of death and decay. A high concentration of the dreaded scarlet rot has mutated the very earth itself, twisting the creatures and plant life that once called this home.

data.name: Cathedral Of Dragon Communion (caelid)
data.description: The Cathedral of Dragon Communion has long been destroyed, but those who seek to commune with draconic power may yet access its power

data.name: Church Of The Plague
data.description: A dilapidated church found in the cliffs east of Sellia, Town of Sorcery

data.name: Fort Gael
data.description: A ruined fort in a ruined land,

data.name: Gael Tunnel
data.description: A set of tunnels found on the western edge of Caelid, along the border to Limgrave

data.name: Forsaken Ruins
data.description: The Forsaken Ruins consists of a group of broken buildings and abandoned campsites. It is located in Caelid and is gaurded by a Giant Crow

data.name: Gaol Cave
data.description: Found at the west of Caelid.

data.name: Gowry's Shack
data.description: A lone shack found below the eastern hills near Sellia, Town of Sorcery.

data.name: Minor Erdtree Catacombs
data.description: Minor Erdtree Catacombs is a Location in Elden Ring. The Minor Erdtree Catacombs is found in Caelid, beneath the Minor Erdtree. Players can reach this location by traveling east from where the region meets with Limgrave and then looking for the entrance behind the tree, in the north.

data.name: Redmane Castle
data.description: A small castle that is heavily guarded at the castle's outskirts by Radahn Knights and Soldiers. The Redmane Castle serves as the gathering point for warriors alike who are wanting to participate in the Radahn Festival

data.name: Minor Erdtree (caelid)
data.description: The Minor Erdtree of Caelid, found in the northwest near the border to Limgrave.

data.name: Sellia Crystal Tunnel
data.description: The crystal mining operation of Sellia is overseen by greedy and aggressive insectoids

data.name: Sellia Evergaol
data.description: Outside of Sellia Evergaol

data.name: Sellia Gateway
data.description: The gateway leading to Sellia, Town of Socrcery

data.name: Sellia, Town Of Sorcery
data.description: A once-great town renowned for its study of the sorcerous arts. Now lying in ruin, the ghosts of its former scholars still roam the streets.

data.name: Smoldering Church
data.description: The Last Church in Limgrave before reaching Caelid

data.name: Shack Of The Rotting
data.description: An old worn-down shack overlooking a long stretch of cliffs in western Caelid.

data.name: Street Of Sages Ruins
data.description: The sages of Caelid are no more, and their former district is now the dwelling of perfumers and their poisonous flowers

data.name: War-dead Catacombs
data.description: Catacombs for those who have died a glorious battle death

data.name: Capital Outskirts
data.description: Capital Outskirts is a Location in Elden Ring. The Capital Outskirts sub-region lies in the Eastern area of the Altus Plateau and is the region just outside Leyndell, Royal Capital but still within the capital's outer walls. Beware of Skeletons rising from their graves and rocks flying out of the capital toward the battlegrounds when exploring the area.

data.name: Altus Tunnel
data.description: The Altus tunnels were once used to supply the lands with quality crystals

data.name: Dominula, Windmill Village
data.description: Dominula, Windmill Village is a Location in Elden Ring. The Dominula, Windmill Village  is found in Altus Plateau. East of the "Road of iniquity Side Path"sight of grace. Follow the main path southeast then bend east.

data.name: East Windmill Pasture
data.description: East Pasture Outskirsts of Windmill Village. True to its name, it can be identified by the still-working windmill placed in the center of the pasture.

data.name: Golden Lineage Evergaol
data.description: An evergaol located on within the Altus Plateau.

data.name: Hermit Merchant's Shack
data.description: Nestled on a cliff within the confines of the Royal Capital, this shack is home to a humble merchant, who has chosen a life of seclusion

data.name: Altus Tunnel
data.description: The Altus tunnels were once used to supply the lands with quality crystals

data.name: Leyndell, Royal Capital
data.description: Leyndell, Royal Capital is a Location in Elden Ring. The Leyndell, Royal Capital region is only accessible to players who have gathered two Great Runes or by following Ranni the Witch quest line and defeating Fia's Champions near the Great Waterfall Crest Site of Grace in the Deeproot Depths, and has content for highly leveled gameplay. For a detailed walkthrough, please visit the walkthrough page for Leyndell, Royal Capital Legacy Dungeon here.

data.name: Lux Ruins
data.description: Long forgotten ruins among golden trees, swarmed with demi-humans protecting the undergound chamber.

data.name: Old Altus Tunnel
data.description: An old mining site, still active to this day. Its tunnels echo with the grunts and groans of the commoners, tirelessly slaving away, grinding at the rich reservoir of crystals deep within

data.name: Minor Erdtree Church
data.description: What's left of the Church of the Minor Erdtree

data.name: Sealed Tunnel
data.description: Not as small or abandoned as it looks.

data.name: Stormcaller Church
data.description: A lonely church on a steppe

data.name: The Shaded Castle
data.description: An abandoned and Decrepit castle found in the northern region between the Mt. Gelmir and the Altus Plateau regions. The castle is half sunken into a poisonous bog, with the air tinged yellow by the fumes.

data.name: Woodfolk Ruins
data.description: Woodfolk Ruins, guarded by Limgrave's creatures, can be found near the Minor Erdtree within Altus Plateau.

data.name: Corpse-stench Shack
data.description: A run-down shack amidst burning corpses past the site of a recent battle.

data.name: Writheblood Ruins
data.description: Writheblood ruins, with nearest minor erdtree in background

data.name: Craftsman's Shack
data.description: A series of long-abandoned huts found directly south of the volcano

data.name: Gelmir Hero's Grave
data.description: Large Catacombs housing an ancient hero of Mt. Gelmir.

data.name: Hermit's Shack
data.description: An abandoned shack along the western edge of Mt. Gelmir

data.name: Fort Laiedd
data.description: Fort Laiedd is found on the western edge of Mt. Gelmir. A fort left broken, still occupied by those who won the battle

data.name: Perfumer's Ruins
data.description: A set of ruins found in Altus Plateau, far to the west and below Mt. Gelmir.

data.name: Hermit Village
data.description: A dilapidated village southeast of Mt. Gelmir. Now home to Demi-Humans.

data.name: Sage's Cave
data.description: Sage's Cave is a dark opening in the side of a mountain. Its dark depths are overrun by hostile undead, but those who brave it may find treasures beyond compare

data.name: Second Church Of Marika
data.description: Second of the four Churches of Marika where players can gather a Sacred Tear for their flask.

data.name: Unsightly Catacombs
data.description: A burial grounds crawling with Misbegotten creatures found deep beneath the Perfumer's Ruins. Despite its decrepit state, the catacombs give off a trace of fragrant aromas juxtaposed by the scent of the ancient dead

data.name: Seethewater Cave
data.description: A cave found along the Seethewater Ravine.

data.name: Wyndham Catacombs
data.description: Burial grounds located beneath Wyndham Ruins.

data.name: Volcano Cave
data.description: A cave system at the highest point of Mt. Gelmir, made into a home by a family of Demi-Humans hiding their maddened Queen.

data.name: Wyndham Ruins
data.description: A large set of ruins atop a burial grounds. The reanimated dead still roam the area

data.name: Bestial Sanctum
data.description: The Beastial Sanctum is a refuge for those who feed on the dead. Beastly and deformed, the clergyman here will teach the ways of the beast to those who feed it

data.name: Dragonbarrow Cave
data.description: A small dungeon found beneath the Minor Erdtree in Dragonbarrow

data.name: Divine Tower Of Caelid
data.description: A massive tower found in central Dragonbarrow, north of Caelid. The sides of the tower are crumbling from the massive overgrowth protruding from the plateau

data.name: Deep Siofra Well
data.description: A second lift to the Siofra River.

data.name: Fort Faroth
data.description: Fort Faroth used to house the guardians of Caelid, but its defenders have long fallen, now bound to earth as hostile spirits

data.name: Lenne's Rise
data.description: An observation tower in the northeast of Dragonbarrow, off the path to the Bestial Sanctum

data.name: Isolated Merchant's Shack (dragonbarrow)
data.description: A lonesome hut found atop a plateau in western Dragonbarrow. Home to a hermit looking to part with various odds and ends... for a price

data.name: Castle Sol
data.description: A castle found in the northeast of the Mountaintops of the Giants. Stronghold of Commander Niall and his spectral knights

data.name: Church Of Repose
data.description: A small crumbled church high on the mountains

data.name: Forge Of The Giants
data.description: The giant's forge could contain a volcano.

data.name: Grand Lift Of Rold
data.description: The impressive Lift of Rold transports those who wield the right key. But could there be more than one destination??

data.name: Guardians' Garrison
data.description: Guardian's Garrison is staffed by Fire Priests, who zealously watch the road leading to the Giant's Forge

data.name: Giant-conquering Hero's Grave
data.description: A complex dungeon filled with invulnerable enemies and strange golden floor seals.

data.name: Shack Of The Lofty
data.description: A lone shack found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. This shack was once visited by a traveling maiden, but she had long since perished under the elements

data.name: Spiritcaller's Cave
data.description: A cave found by the Freezing Lake, heavily battered by the elements

data.name: Stargazer's Ruins
data.description: A set of ruins found in central Mountaintops of the Giants. The plateau it is sitting on is located between two bridges.

data.name: Zamor Ruins
data.description: The ancient Town of Zamor, now fallen to ruin. Its anzient order of knights still roam the snow-capped streets

data.name: Consecrated Snowfield Catacombs
data.description: The Catacombs of the fields leading to Miquella's Haligtree hide powerful secrets, but are zealously guarded

data.name: Apostate Derelict
data.description: A ruined church lying in the frozen north-west of the Consecrated Grounds

data.name: Heretical Rise
data.description: The secrets of Heretical Rise are closely guarded by hidden magic, but the tower is overrun with hostile Avionette Soldiers

data.name: Hidden Path To The Haligtree
data.description: The secret passage leading to Miquella's Haligtree has been polluted by Those Who Live in Dead

data.name: Yelough Anix Ruins
data.description: A set of ruins found in the northwest of the Consecrated Snowfield

data.name: Ordina, Liturgical Town
data.description: Ghost town inhabitated in the evergaol

data.name: Yelough Anix Tunnel
data.description: An icy tunnel on the southern edge of the Yelough Anix Ruins

data.name: Smithing Master Hewg
data.quote: I'm a prisoner, and these are my chains. I'm trapped by the Hold, undying, smithing for you fools. That's all there is to it.

data.name: Roderika
data.quote: Everyone who came with me. They crossed the sea for me. They fought, for me. Heh... Only to have their arms taken. Their legs taken. Even their heads...taken. Taken and stuck to the spider.

data.name: Thops
data.quote: For a small donation, I'd be happy to share my knowledge.
data.location: Church of Irith in Liurnia of the Lakes

data.name: Enia
data.quote: The Fingers guide us all. And you Tarnished, you are here to take, are you not?

data.name: Miriel, Pastor Of Vows
data.quote: I Welcome you, to the Church of Vows. I am Miriel, steward of this sacred chamber. My apologies, for the unseemly state of affairs. Do you know the origin of this place?
data.role: Steward of the Church of Vows

data.name: War Counselor Iji
data.quote: Well, look at you. We don't receive many visitors
data.location: Kingsrealm Ruins, Western Liurnia of the Lakes

data.name: Sorcerer Rogier
data.quote: The pleasure's mine. Rogier's the name. A sorcerer, as you might have guessed.

data.name: Gurranq, Beast Clergyman
data.quote: I feel it's stench on you... death. Feed it to me.

data.name: Boc The Seamster
data.quote: Hm? Oh, yes I remember. Some clod turned me into a tree.

data.name: Brother Corhyn
data.quote: I teach incantations, the strength granted us by the Two Fingers, and explore the secrets of the Golden Order. So that one day, if a Tarnished of the Roundtable Hold should become Elden Lord, I might counsel them, ensuring order regains its proper form, righting rule over men.

data.name: D, Hunter Of The Dead
data.quote: Insert NPC quote here.

data.name: Knight Bernahl
data.quote: Let me ask you something Are you here in the Lands Between to take up the fight? Does your faith in the guidance of grace hold firm, despite the collapse of the Golden Order?

data.name: Pidia, Carian Servant
data.quote: But please, can you offer poor ill-starred Pidia...

data.name: Melina
data.quote: Have you heard of the finger maidens? They serve the Two Fingers, offering guidance, and aid, to the Tarnished. But you, I am afraid, are maidenless. I can play the role of maiden.
data.location: The beginning of the Tarnished's journey.

data.name: Bloody Finger Hunter Yura
data.quote: Be on your way. Perhaps we will meet again, if fate permits

data.name: Iron Fist Alexander
data.quote: I am Alexander, also known as the Iron Fist. And as you can see, I'm stuck here.

data.name: White-faced Varré
data.quote: Are you familiar with grace? The golden light that gives life to you Tarnished You may also behold its golden rays pointing in a particular direction at times That is the guidance of grace. The path that a Tarnished must travel.

data.name: Renna
data.quote: Unless thou should take the crown?"

data.name: Fia
data.quote: Great champion, would you allow me to hold you, but briefly?

data.name: Edgar
data.quote: Even if the castle should fall, as commander, I must remain.

data.name: Irina
data.quote: My good father secreted me out the castle, but decided himself to stay. He says it's his duty, as commander. I... I fear for father's life.

data.name: Kenneth Haight
data.quote: Hello? Is anybody there? Someone who might be interested on rescuing the great Kenneth Haight? Servant of the true Order, and celebrated repudiator of the false!, O Erdtree! Grant me succour!

data.name: Queen Marika
data.quote: Now, Queen Marika the Eternal is nowhere to be found, and in the Night of the Black Knives Godwyn the Golden was first to perish. Soon, Marika's offspring, demigods all, claimed the shards of the Elden Ring. The mad taint of their newfound strength triggered the Shattering.

data.name: Knight Diallos
data.quote: The tale of House Hoslow is told in blood. I, Diallos, swear to deliver that promise.

data.name: Frustrated Spirit
data.quote: All I wanted was to fight. To fight, as a warrior, to the last... So, Why? Why, O guidance of grace, will this door not open?

data.name: Frustrated Spirit
data.quote: All I wanted was to fight. To fight, as a warrior, to the last... So, Why? Why, O guidance of grace, will this door not open?

data.name: Gideon Ofnir
data.quote: As a Tarnished who wishes to stand before the Elden Ring and become Elden Lord, I am accumulating knowledge. To be all-knowing.

data.name: Patches
data.quote: I'm Patches. Patches the Untethered.
data.role: x2 Golden Rune (1), Grovel for Mercy

data.name: Hyetta
data.quote: Hello? Is someone there? My name is Hyetta, and I'm journeying in search of the distant light. If I might be so bold as to ask... would you donate any Shabriri grapes in your possession to me? My eyesight has been weak since birth, you see. I can't tell which way I'm supposed to go next.

data.name: Palm Reader
data.quote: You, please, I can read them. Your fingers, please, your fingers...

data.name: Nepheli Loux
data.quote: Be proud. You were a fine warrior. Your only mistake was your choice of master.

data.name: Rya
data.quote: A pleasure to meet you, Brave Tarnished.

data.name: Tanith
data.quote: I am Tanith, the proprietress of this house. An honour to have you.

data.name: Ranni The Witch
data.quote: I am the witch Ranni. I stole Death long ago, and search now for the dark path.

data.name: Primeval Sorcerer Azur
data.quote: A mysterious and silent figure residing near the Hermit Village.

data.name: Dung Eater
data.quote: I told you not to disturb me

data.name: Preceptor Seluvis
data.quote: I don't know what it is the mistress sees in a provincial Tarnished like you, but since we have the misfortune of serving the same Lady, I ask that you kindly try not to drag us all down with you.

data.name: Blaidd
data.quote: The name's Blaidd. I'm looking for a man who goes by "Darriwil."

data.name: Gowry
data.quote: The rotting sickness that afflicts Millicent has no cure. When the Erdtree flourished, even the demigods could not stave off its effects, despite their nigh godhood.

data.name: Millicent
data.quote: I would rather trust you than simply continue to spoil from within.

data.name: Bloodhunter Raz
data.quote: ...I've still my pride. I'm not going out like a complete monster.

data.name: Latenna
data.quote: Foul tarnished, what do you want?
data.location: Liurnia of the Lakes, Slumbering Wolf's Shack

data.name: Albus
data.quote: Please, no. Dear me!. I haven't a clue. No secrets lie with me, not a one.
data.location: Village of the Albinaurics, Liurnia of the Lakes

data.name: Shabriri
data.quote: May chaos take the world! May chaos take the world!

data.name: Witch-hunter Jerren
data.quote: Brave champion, you have our gratitude

data.name: Blackguard Big Boggart
data.quote: Never met someone with a taste for prawns I couldn't trust.

data.name: Buckler
data.description: A small metal roundshield. The bump in the center enables parrying techniques. A well-timed parry can break an enemy's stance, allowing a critical hit. Best suited for those prepared to take the risk to reap their reward.

data.name: Perfumer's Shield
data.description: Golden shield used by the perfumers of Leyndell during military service. Made to be thin and light of weight, even those lacking strength can employ this immunity-boosting shield.

data.name: Man-serpent's Shield
data.description: Small copper dome-shaped roundshield carried by the man-serpents of Mt. Gelmir. Said to have been tempered in lava, it boasts great resistance to fire.

data.name: Pillory Shield
data.description: Pillory made to punish serious felons, used as a shield. Though made of good, sturdy wood, it is only a makeshift tool and performs as such. Perhaps due to its use as a device with which the guilty were made to endure prolonged suffering, it raises vitality.

data.name: Rickety Shield
data.description: A creaky old wooden shield, circular in shape. Roughly reinforced with vines or some such. There are countless other shields available of better make. This piece of scrap isn't worth the effort of equipping.

data.name: Beastman's Jar-shield
data.description: Shield fashioned from a tall broken jar carried by the beastmen of Farum Azula. There is a particular knack to wielding it. The beastmen have always fired earthenware jars for the express purpose of making shields. Such are their ways, strange though they are.

data.name: Red Thorn Roundshield
data.description: A small, wooden roundshield. It is light and easy to use, but cannot offer the damage negation of a metal shield. Its emblem is an ancient red thorn design. Though it isn't much, it boosts fire damage negation.

data.name: Riveted Wooden Shield
data.description: Small wooden roundshield that has been reinforced with metal. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a true metal shield. The design riveted to the center represents both sword and tree.

data.name: Scripture Wooden Shield
data.description: A small, wooden roundshield. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a metal shield. An ancient cipher engraving linesd the circumference. Though it isn't much, it boosts holy damage negation.

data.name: Blue-white Wooden Shield
data.description: Small wooden roundshield that has been reinforced with metal. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a true metal shield. The design is said to represent the stars of the night sky, portending fate.

data.name: Rift Shield
data.description: Small metal roundshiled depicting a sinister rift. An antiquated charm that glares back at an enemy, it boosts focus.

data.name: Iron Roundshield
data.description: An ordinary small roundshield made of metal. Heavier than a wooden shield, but boasts higher damage negation. Finely balanced, this shield is easy to use.

data.name: Smoldering Shield
data.description: Small shield made upon Mt. Gelmir forged from uncooling lava. Resists frost with its heat, and can even be used to deal fire damage if wielded as a weapon.

data.name: Gilded Iron Shield
data.description: Small metal roundshield. Heavier than a wooden shield, but boasts higher damage negation. Though the gold leaf is peeling and the effect is slight, it still boosts holy damage negation.

data.name: Ice Crest Shield
data.description: Small metal roundshield. Heavier than a wooden shield, but boasts higher damage negation. The ice crest originates from a Carian princess. Thogh the effect is slight, it boosts magic damage negation and resistance to frost.

data.name: Spiralhorn Shield
data.description: Small shield of antlers arranged in an eddy-like pattern. If used to attack a foe, the shield's antlers inflict blood loss. Once given to a Tarnished warrior who cultivated close ties to the ancestral followers. Though the effect is only slight, it boosts immunity, robustness, and focus.

data.name: Marred Leather Shield
data.description: Leather shield of Stormveil soldiers. Miuch like the castle, it is marred by mottling and thorns. Some say it is the curse of grafting which causes such affliction, while others talk of its root being something altogether more sinister hidden deep within the castle.

data.name: Marred Wooden Shield
data.description: "Wooden shield of the Stormveil soldiers. Much like the castle, it is marred by mottling and thorns. Some say it is the curse of grafting which causes such affliction, while others talk of its root being something altogether more sinister hidden deep within the castle."

data.name: Coil Shield
data.description: An extremely odd shield adorned with a coiled bronze snake. An excellent choice for attention-seekers. This Shield provides an effective defense against poison - after all, how does one poison a poisonous snake?

data.name: Kite Shield
data.description: A standard medium-sized metal shield. Metal shields reliably negate physical damage when guarding, a trait which made them highly trusted on the battlefield.

data.name: Banished Knight's Shield
data.description: A tall medium-sized metal shield. Given to knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. Most of these knights were sent to the fringes, where they were forced to start anew with only despair for company.

data.name: Albinauric Shield
data.description: Tall oval shield made of metal carried by young Albinaurics. The ornamentation represents the primordial drop of dew from which they are said to have been created. Boasts exceptional magic damage negation. The Albinaurics' most formidable foes were sorcerers, after all.

data.name: Sun Realm Shield
data.description: Shield of honor depicting a city crowned by the sun. It has seen better days. Much like the wear upon the shield, the Seat of the Sun is long faded away.

data.name: Silver Mirrorshield
data.description: Shield of radiant silver, festooned with amber and carried by Loretta, Knight of the Haligtree. The shape is said to imitate that of a sacred drop of dew, which inspired the absurd rumor that Loretta herself was an Albinauric.

data.name: Round Shield
data.description: A wooden roundshield that has been reinforced with metal. Comparatively light for its size, this shield is easy to handle but lacks a true metal shield's ability to negate damage.

data.name: Scorpion Kite Shield
data.description: A standard medium-sized metal shield. Highly reputed for its solid build and reliability. Emblazoned with a yellow scorpion, a warning of surprise attacks and sudden strikes.

data.name: Twinbird Kite Shield
data.description: Shield featuring a vividly painted twinbird. The twinbird is said to be the envoy of an outer god, and mother of the Deathbirds. At dwindling levels of HP, this shield slightly boosts both attack and defense.

data.name: Blue-gold Kite Shield
data.description: A standard medium-sized shield. Highly reputed for its solid build and reliability. The design represents the Erdtree foreground against a blue sky.

data.name: Brass Shield
data.description: On the larger side for medium-sized shield, the face has been covered in brass. Commonly employed in the Shattering.

data.name: Shield Of The Guilty
data.description: Shield made to venerate a maiden whose eyes were crushed by Briars of Sin before being reborn in these lands. Venerating the repose of the soul, this shield boosts focus. The briars can be used to attack foes.

data.name: Great Turtle Shell
data.description: Shield fashioned from a great turtle shell. The natural curve helps it contend with foes' attacks. The turtle is a symbol of tirelessness, and this shield boosts stamina recovery speed.

data.name: Carian Knight's Shield
data.description: A teardrop-shaped shield embedded with blue glintstones. Carried by knights who served the Carian royal family. Excels when facing magic or holy attacks. Just who were these knights preparing to fight?

data.name: Horse Crest Wooden Shield
data.description: A tall, medium-sized wooden shield. Light for its size, and easy to handle. The circular horsehead design evokes a swift gallop.

data.name: Candletree Wooden Shield
data.description: A tall, medium-sized wooden shield. Light for its size, and easy to handle. Thought to represent a surreptitious prophecy of cardinal sin, the lit candle-tree design was forbidden.

data.name: Large Leather Shield
data.description: A round shield covered in leather. One of the larger categories of medium-sized shield. Though its damage negation may be lacking compared to a metal shield, it can handle wider range of attack affinities.

data.name: Flame Crest Wooden Shield
data.description: A tall, medium-sized wooden shield. Light for its size, and easy to handle. Carried by soldiers of the village that is afflicted by frenzy. The yellow flame is the symbol of the affliction, serving as a warning to those who might approach the village.

data.name: Hawk Crest Wooden Shield
data.description: A tall, medium-sized wooden shield. Light for its size, and easy to handle. Adorned with a long-forgotten crest of Stormveil, ancient in design.

data.name: Beast Crest Heater Shield
data.description: A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield. Features a beast as its crest, serving to remind warriors not to succumb to the arousal of battle. Fight with passion, but become nor its prisoner.

data.name: Red Crest Heater Shield
data.description: A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield. The crest symbolizes red wings.

data.name: Eclipse Crest Heater Shield
data.description: A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield. The sun in eclipse is said to be the symbol of the Wandering Mausoleum where the soulless demigods slumber.

data.name: Blue Crest Heater Shield
data.description: A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield. The crest represents a forest and river.

data.name: Inverted Hawk Heater Shield
data.description: A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield. The inverted hawk is the emblem of the company of slaves ordered to explore the Eternal City.

data.name: Heater Shield
data.description: A medium-sized metal shield, comparatively easy to handle. Metal shields reliably negate physical damage when guarding, a trait which made them highly trusted on the battlefield.

data.name: Black Leather Shield
data.description: Roundshield covered in black leather. On the larger side for a medium-sized shield. From the north, this shield depicts the polar star in rivets of gold. The inside is lined with fur, protecting the carrier from frost.

data.name: Dragon Towershield
data.description: Tower shield engraved with a dragon, symbol of protection. Heavy even among greatshields, it possesses exceptional guarding ability The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock.

data.name: Crucible Hornshield
data.description: Greatshield of red-tinged gold carried by Crucible Knights. Features a great horn. An ancient holiness dwells within. The crucible horn skewers foes when performing shield bashes.

data.name: Distinguished Greatshield
data.description: Greatshield featuring sumptuous ornamentation used by the scions of great families. Due to their excessive size, these shields were at times seen as the hallmark of little lordlings who were too timid to earn a few nicks and scratches.

data.name: Dragonclaw Shield
data.description: Greatshield said to have been whittled from the claw of a great, ancient dragon, wielded by grotesque Tree Sentinels who yet serve the Edrtree. Imbued with lightning.

data.name: Golden Beast Crest Shield
data.description: Shield of dull gold with a beast engraved as its crest. Lighter than most greratshields, and subsequently easier to wield. The beast depicted is Serosh, aged counselor who guides the golden lineage.

data.name: Erdtree Greatshield
data.description: Weighty greatshield forged of gold carried by the order of Tree Sentinels, heavily equipped knights. Blessed by an old incantation of protection. The living rampart of the Erdtree, the Tree Sentinels are the standard to which all defenders of the Erdtree aspire.

data.name: Briar Greatshield
data.description: Greatshield from a foreign land, used by Elemer of the Briar. Attacks with this armament utilize the iron thorns that have been wound around its frame. Originates from Eochaid, a land of proudly solitary ascetics.

data.name: Jellyfish Shield
data.description: The head of a spirit jellyfish, commonly found floating above sacred ground throughout the Lands Between, wielded without modification as a shield. The see-through head is extremely light, but its flesh is supple, providing absolutely no protection from piercing attacks

data.name: Fingerprint Stone Shield
data.description: A great stone shield with an intricately carved fingerprint design. One of the heaviest of all greatshields. Part of the tomb of an ancient god, the Readerless Fingers relayed their message through these imprints, said to be the very seeds from which frenzy first sprouted.

data.name: Icon Shield
data.description: Greatshield painted with a divine scene; the recipients of a blessed tear from the Erdtree. An item that looks back fondly on the age of plenty. The divine scene acts in and of itself as a sacred invocation; gradually restoring the carrier's HP.

data.name: Visage Shield
data.description: Tricksome bronze shield depicting the face of a Fire Giant. Several tongues leap from its open mouth. The dreadful visage and burning flames are designed to remind one of the horror of facing a Fire Giant. In other words, this shield has an instructional function.

data.name: One-eyed Shield
data.description: Tricksome shield made from white stone depicting a malformed one-eyed god. The barrel of a firearm pokes through the open mouth. Once worshipped by the giants, this evil deity is believed to have been slain by Queen Marika.

data.name: Spiked Palisade Shield
data.description: Designed to perform shield bashes, these attacks riddle the enemy with holes, earning it the nickname of "pard shield"

data.name: Manor Towershield
data.description: An iron greatshield large enough to cover the entire body. Depicts the Roundtable Hold, gathering place of champions. Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel.

data.name: Crossed-tree Towershield
data.description: An iron greatshield large enough to cover the entire body. Emblazoned with an old, interleaving tree. Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel

data.name: Redmane Greatshield
data.description: Greatshield shaped like a fang, featuring the crest of red-maned lion. Carried by the Redmane Knights who fought alongside Radahn.

data.name: Ant's Skull Plate
data.description: Huge head of one of the giant ants which inhabit the two underground rivers, used without modification as a shield. Excels at repeling enemy attacks. Giant ants are venomous creatures, granting a boost to immunity when wielding the shield.

data.name: Inverted Hawk Towershield
data.description: An iron greatshield large enough to cover the entire body. Features an inverted hawk crest. Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel.

data.name: Eclipse Crest Greatshield
data.description: Metal greatshield painted with a sun in eclipse. Carried by the headless mausoleum knights. The eclipsed sun, drained of color, is the protective star of soulless demigods. It aids the mausoleum knights by keeping Destined Death at bay. No skill. This armament has no skill. If the armament in the other hand has a skill, that skill will be used instead.

data.name: Cuckoo Greatshield
data.description: Metal Greatshield painted with a peering cuckoo. Carried by the enchanted knights sworn to the academy. Boasting high magic damage negation, this shield is used to hunt down mages. Our Enemys is none other then caria itself

data.name: Gilded Greatshield
data.description: Metal greatshield coated with gold. Carried by knights loyal to Godrick. The red tinge in the gold coat mirrors the primordial matter that became the Erdtree. The color of homeward yearning.

data.name: Golden Greatshield
data.description: Oval greatshield made of gold, carried by knights who protect the Royal Capital of Leyndell. Knights of Leyndell are reputed for their sturdiness, exemplified by this shield's exceptional guard capacity.

data.name: Haligtree Crest Greatshield
data.description: Metal greatshield depicting the Haligtree with unalloyed gold. Carried by knights who have vowed to serve Miquella's Haligtree. Possesses high holy damage negation. Yet now, with the Haligtree misshapen, this wondrous rendition is a fleeting fantasy.

data.name: Wooden Greatshield
data.description: Wooden greatshield reinforced with a metal ornamentation. Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel.

data.name: Lordsworn's Shield
data.description: Wooden tower shield. Lightweightfor a greatshield and easy to handle. Commonly used in the Shattering. Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel.

data.name: Briars Of Punishment
data.description: An aberrant sorcery discovered by exiled criminals. Theirs are the sorceries most reviled by the academy. Wounds the caster with thorns of sin, sending a trail of bloodthorns running over the ground to impale enemies from below. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly. The guilty, their eyes gouged by thorns, lived in eternal darkness. There, they discovered the blood star.
data.effects: Wounds caster to unleash trail of bloodthrorns

data.name: Ancient Death Rancor
data.description: Sorcery of the servants of Death.
data.effects: Summons horde of vengeful spirits that chase down foes

data.name: Briars Of Sin
data.description: An aberrant sorcery, discovered along with red glintstone by those exiled to the north for their crimes. Summons large thorns from a whorl of blood shed by one's own hand in penance for sins. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly. The Academy reviles this sorcery, which draws its power from faith.
data.effects: Summons thorns from a whorl of your own blood.

data.name: Cannon Of Haima
data.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Lobs an explosive magic projectile that flies in an arc. Charging enhances potency. Drawn from the conspectus of Haima, the adjudicator of the academy, this sorcery employs might as a means to quell conflict.
data.effects: Lobs an explosive magic projectile in an arc

data.name: Ambush Shard
data.description: One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery. Launches a projectile from a distance removed from the caster, so as to strike the enemy from behind. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly. The Sellian sorcerers were assassins, and it is said that they often hunted their fellows.
data.effects: Strikes from behind with projectile fired from distance

data.name: Carian Phalanx
data.description: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.
data.effects: Forms a defensive arch of numerous magic glintblades

data.name: Adula's Moonblade
data.description: Sorcery of Adula, the Glintstone Dragon. Conjures a cold magic greatsword, then delivers a sweeping blow that launches a blade-like projectile of frost. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly. Adula, a devourer of sorcerers, was bested by Ranni and subsequently swore a knightly oath to her Dark Moon.
data.effects: Sweeping slash followed by cold blade projectile

data.name: Carian Greatsword
data.description: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family. Conjures a magic greatsword and then delivers a sweeping blow. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly. Armed with this spell, sorcerers gain the strength of knights, their loyalty sworn to the moon.
data.effects: Performs sweeping slash using magical greatsword

data.name: Carian Piercer
data.description: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.
data.effects: Impales foes with magical greatsword

data.name: Carian Retaliation
data.description: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.
data.effects: Dispels enemy spells and retaliates with glintblades

data.name: Carian Slicer
data.description: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.
data.effects: Performs swift sweeping slash using magical sword

data.name: Crystal Barrage
data.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
data.effects: Fires a volley of glintstone crystal shards

data.name: Collapsing Stars
data.description: One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces.
data.effects: Pulls foes toward caster with gravity projectile volley

data.name: Comet Azur
data.description: Legendary sorcery devised by Azur, primeval sorcerer. Fires a tremendous comet in a torrent akin to the distant starry expanse, the place said to be the origin of glintstone. Hold to continue releasing the sorcery's power. When Azur glimpsed into the primeval current, he saw darkness. He was left both bewitched and fearful of the abyss.
data.effects: Fires a tremendous comet within a starry torrent

data.name: Crystal Burst
data.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Fires a burst of glintstone crystal shards. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion. Charging increases potency. A sorcery of the Crystal Cadre, a group of sorcerers who pursued the wisdom of stone - the secrets locked in the faint cogitation of the Crystalians.
data.effects: Fires a burst of glintstone crystal shards

data.name: Comet
data.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Fires a great magical comet. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion. Charging enhances potency. The greatest of the Karolos Conspectus's sorceries, that only a very few sorcerers have ever mastered.
data.effects: Fires a great magic comet

data.name: Crystal Torrent
data.description: Sorcery of the mysterious Crystalians.
data.effects: Creates crystal mass that fires stream of crystal shards

data.name: Crystal Release
data.description: Sorcery of the mysterious Crystalians. Creates a mass of crystal, then shatters it to scour a wide area with a violent rain of crystal shards. This sorcery is used by high-ranking adepts among the Crystalians. Some also call this sorcery "the Crystal Sun."
data.effects: Scours area with violent rain of crystal shards

data.name: Fia's Mist
data.description: Sorcery of Fia, the Deathbed Companion. Creates a deathly mist before the caster, which inflicts Death blight upon those who enter. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Charging enhances range of the mist. This sorcery was developed to oppose the Roundtable Hold, and is effective only against the Tarnished.
data.effects: Release a mist of death before caster

data.name: Eternal Darkness
data.description: Forbidden sorcery of Sellia, Town of Sorcery.
data.effects: Creates a dark space that draws in spells

data.name: Frozen Armament
data.description: Sorcery said to have been used by the old snow witch. Enchants armament held in the right hand with frost. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. The snowy crone taught the young Ranni to fear the dark moon as she imparted her cold sorcery.
data.effects: Enchants right-hand armament with frost

data.name: Founding Rain Of Stars
data.description: The eldest primeval sorcery, said to have been discovered by an
data.effects: Releases a downpour of star rain for a while

data.name: Explosive Ghostflame
data.description: Sorcery of the servants of Death.
data.effects: Causes ghostflame explosion that burns wide area

data.name: Freezing Mist
data.description: Sorcery said to have been used by the old snow witch.
data.effects: Releases cold mist before caster

data.name: Gelmir's Fury
data.description: One of the sorceries developed from the magma of Mt. Gelmir.
data.effects: Covers area with surge of magma from the earth

data.name: Gavel Of Haima
data.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Creates a magical greathammer and slams it down. Allows one follow-up attack. Drawn from the scholarly conspectus of Haima, the adjudicator of the academy, this sorcery employs might as a means to quell conflict.
data.effects: Attacks using a magic greathammer

data.name: Glintstone Arc
data.description: Fires a horizontal arc of magic that spreads outward. This sorcery can be cast repeteadly and while in motion.
data.effects: Fires a horizontally-widening magic arc

data.name: Glintstone Cometshard
data.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Fires a magical comet with a trailing tail. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion. Charging enhances potency. A sorcery of the Karolos Conspectus, the most venerable of the academy.
data.effects: Fires a magic comet with a trailing tail

data.name: Glintstone Pebble
data.description: The most basic glintstone sorcery of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
data.effects: Fires magic projectiles from glintstone

data.name: Glintstone Stars
data.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
data.effects: Fires three shooting stars that pursue foes

data.name: Glintstone Icecrag
data.description: Sorcery said to have been used by the old snow witch.
data.effects: Fires mass of cold magic from glintstone

data.name: Glintblade Phalanx
data.description: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.
data.effects: Forms a defensive arch of magic glintblades

data.name: Gravity Well
data.description: One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces. Fires a projectile of condensed gravitational force. Those struck by it will be pulled toward the caster. Charging enhances potency. A gravitational technique studied by the young Radahn. His master was an Alabaster Lord with skin of stone.
data.effects: Pulls foes toward caster with gravity projectile

data.name: Great Glintstone Shard
data.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. The glintstone serves as a conduit, launching large magical projectiles at foes. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion. Those unworthy of the stone crown typically end their brief journey into sorcery here.
data.effects: Fires larger magic projectiles from glintstone

data.name: Lucidity
data.description: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.
data.effects: Alleviates buildup of sleep and madness

data.name: Greatblade Phalanx
data.description: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family. Creates a defensive arch of larger magic glintblades overhead, which automatically attack nearby foes. Used by the enchanted troll knights. They were the comrades of the young Rennala, bound by oath.
data.effects: Forms a defensive arch of larger magic glintblades

data.name: Great Oracular Bubble
data.description: Sorcery of the claymen who served as priests in the ancient
data.effects: Launches a large magic bubble

data.name: Oracle Bubble
data.description: Sorcery of the claymen who served as priests in the ancient dynasty.
data.effects: Launches several bubbles of magic.

data.name: Loretta's Greatbow
data.description: Sorcery used by Royal Knight Loretta. Creates a magic greatbow and fires a great arrow. Charging enhances potency. Hold to keep the great arrow nocked. It is said that the bow was Loretta's favored weapon.
data.effects: Fires great arrow from a magic greatbow

data.name: Loretta's Mastery
data.description: Sorcery used by Loretta, Knight of the Haligtree. Creates a magic greatbow and fires four great arrows simultaneously. Charging enhances potency. Hold to keep the great arrows nocked. Developed by Loretta after her long, bloody journey to seek out a place where the Albinaurics could live in peace.
data.effects: Fires four great arrow from a magic greatbow at once

data.name: Magic Downpour
data.description: One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.
data.effects: Summon a magic mass that sprays projectiles over area

data.name: Magic Glintblade
data.description: An old sorcery of the Carian Royal Family.
data.effects: Creates sigil that forms a projectile glintblade after delay

data.name: Magma Shot
data.description: One of the sorceries developed from the magma of Mt. Gelmir.
data.effects: Fire lump of magma that explodes on contact

data.name: Meteorite
data.description: A glintstone sorcery that draws on gravitational force, used by a great white king with stone skin. Calls small meteorites down from the sky. The meteor shower continues for as long as the sorcery is in effect. It is said that, in the Eternal City, now lost in ruin underground, meteorites held the same import as stars.
data.effects: Calls small meteors down from the sky.

data.name: Night Comet
data.description: One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery.
data.effects: Fires semi-invisible magic comet

data.name: Meteorite Of Astel
data.description: One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces. Summons a void that emits a hail of meteorites. Hold to continue the effect. A manifestation of the power with which Astel leveled the Eternal City.
data.effects: Calls a hail of small meteorites from the void.

data.name: Night Shard
data.description: One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery.
data.effects: Swiftly fires a semi-invisible

data.name: Night Maiden's Mist
data.description: One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery.
data.effects: Releases life-sapping silver mist before caster

data.name: Rancorcall
data.description: Sorcery of the servants of Death.
data.effects: Summons vengeful spirits that chase down foes

data.name: Oracle Bubbles
data.description: Sorcery of the claymen who served as priests in the ancient
data.effects: Launches several small magic bubbles.

data.name: Rennala's Full Moon
data.description: Sorcery associated with the Carian queen. Uses the caster as a vessel to incarnate a full moon, then sends it floating toward foes. The full moon dispels all sorcery that touches it, and temporarily reduces magic damage negation for those it strikes. Queen Rennala encountered this enchanting moon when she was young, and later, it would bewitch the academy.
data.effects: Incarnate a full moon and launch it at foes

data.name: Ranni's Dark Moon
data.description: Legendary sorcery associated with the Carian queen.
data.effects: Incarnate a cold, dark moon and launch it at foes.

data.name: Rock Blaster
data.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
data.effects: Thurst staff into ground to emit a massive shockwave

data.name: Roiling Magma
data.description: One of the sorceries developed from the magma of Mt. Gelmir. Fires a lump of condensed magma that explodes a short delay after hitting the target. Charging enhances potency and further delays the explosion. After discovering the ancient hexes of Gelmir, Rykard, son of Queen Rennala, brought them back into practical use as new forms of sorcery.
data.effects: Fires lump of magma that explodes after delay

data.name: Rykard's Rancor
data.description: The terrible power of Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy.
data.effects: Releases searing spirits that repeatedly explode after delay

data.name: Rock Sling
data.description: One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces.
data.effects: Summons rocks from the earth and sends its flying

data.name: Scholar's Armament
data.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
data.effects: Enchants right-hand armament with magic damage

data.name: Scholar's Shield
data.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
data.effects: Enhances left-handed shield damage negation

data.name: Shard Spiral
data.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
data.effects: Fire twin spiraling projectiles

data.name: Shatter Earth
data.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Imbues the ferrule of the caster's staff with magic, then thrusts it into the ground to create a magical shockwave. Allows one follow-up attack. A Stonedigger sorcery used by the glintstone miners of the crystal tunnel. At the academy, use of this sorcery was a stigma that marked out failed scholars.
data.effects: Thrust staff into ground to emit a shockwave

data.name: Starlight
data.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
data.effects: Creates star light to illuminate surroundings

data.name: Star Shower
data.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Fires six magic shooting stars that pursue the target. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Charging enhances potency. The most difficult to master of the Olivinus Conspectus sorceries.
data.effects: Fires six shooting stars that pursue foes

data.name: Stars Of Ruin
data.description: Legendary sorcery devised by Lusat, primeval sorcerers.
data.effects: Fire twelve dark shooting stars that pursue foes

data.name: Shattering Crystal
data.description: Sorcery of the mysterious Crystalians. Creates a mass of crystal, then shatters it in a forward burst. Charging enhances potency. The Crystalians are inorganic beings, yet they live. They cleave close to the ideals of the primeval current, and as such, they are revered guests of the sorcerers.
data.effects: Creates crystal mass that shatters in forward burst

data.name: Swift Glintstone Shard
data.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. The glintstone serves as a conduit, launching swift magical projectiles at foes. This sorcery can be used without delay after performing another action. Those unworthy of the stone crown typically end their brief journey into sorcery here.
data.effects: Swiftly fires magic projectiles from glintstone

data.name: Terra Magicus
data.description: One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Draws an academy sigil upon the ground, raising the magic strength of those within. Once, the sigil would be cast from the highest belfry of the academy, covering the entire institution's grounds. This spell allows such vivid experience of spell—casting success, it turns many a fledgling into a true sorcerer in a flash of newfound understanding.
data.effects: Raises the magic strength of those within the sigil

data.name: Unseen Blade
data.description: One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery. Enchants armament held in right hand, making it completely invisible. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Used by Sellian assassins to present themselves as unarmed sorcerers.
data.effects: Makes right-hand armament completely invisible

data.name: Unseen Form
data.description: One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery. Makes the caster semi-invisible. While on horseback, effect extends to cover the mount. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. The Sellian assassins considered every option that aided their dirty work.
data.effects: Makes the caster semi-invisible

data.name: Thops's Barrier
data.description: The lifelong pursuit of Thops the Bluntstone.
data.effects: Erect a magic forcefield to deflect spells

data.name: Zamor Ice Storm
data.description: Ice sorcery of the Town of Zamor.
data.effects: Thrust staff into ground to create freezing tornado.

data.name: Tibia's Summons
data.description: Sorcery of the servants of Death. Summons a group of Those Lost in Death. Three skeletons will appear some distance from the caster and attack foes before disappearing. The dead have long been left to wander; what they need is leadership.
data.effects: Summons Those Who Live in Death

data.name: Albinauric Ashes
data.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of two Albinaurics.

data.name: Ancestral Follower Ashes
data.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of an ancestral follower.

data.name: Archer Ashes
data.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon three archer spirits.

data.name: Avionette Soldier Ashes
data.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of two avionette soldiers. Spirits of marionette soldiers with avian features that were created to serve a sorcerer. Equipped with long-hafted scythes, they also attack from the skies by lobbing fire pots. Can sometimes malfunction when damaged.
data.effect: Summon the spirits of two avionette soldiers

data.name: Banished Knight Oleg
data.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of Oleg, the Banished Knight.

data.name: Demi-human Ashes
data.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of five demi-humans.

data.name: Fanged Imp Ashes
data.description: Ashes remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon two fanged imp spirits.

data.name: Finger Maiden Therolina Puppet
data.description: One of Seluvis's puppets.
data.effect: Summons spirit of Finger Maiden Therolina

data.name: Giant Rat Ashes
data.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of three giant rats.

data.name: Black Knife Tiche
data.description: Legendary ashen remains. Use to summon the spirit of Black Knife Tiche.
data.effect: Summons spirit of Black Knife Tiche

data.name: Glintstone Sorcerer Ashes
data.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of a glintstone sorcerer.

data.name: Godrick Soldier Ashes
data.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of two of Godrick's soldiers.

data.name: Jarwight Puppet
data.description: One of Seluvis' puppets. Use to summon the spirit of a jarwight.

data.name: Kaiden Sellsword Ashes
data.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell.Use to summon the spirit of a Kaiden sellsword.

data.name: Greatshield Soldier Ashes
data.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon five greatshield soldier spirits.

data.name: Lhutel The Headless
data.description: Legendary ashen remains. Use to summon the spirit of Lhutel the Headless.
data.effect: Summons spirit of Lhutel the Headless

data.name: Mad Pumpkin Head Ashes
data.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of a mad pumpkin head. Spirit of a mad soldier with a large, brawny physique. Though he has stifled his panic within the dark confines of his helmet, he rampages as if driven mad when agitated by bloodshed or the humming of insects. This mad soldier is all that is left of a broken gladiator.
data.effect: Summon the spirit of a mad pumpkin head

data.name: Marionette Soldier Ashes
data.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of two marionette soldiers.

data.name: Lone Wolf Ashes
data.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of three lone wolves.

data.name: Mimic Tear Ashes
data.description: Legendary ashen remains. Use to summon the spirit of a mimic tear. Summoning consumes HP rather than FP.

data.name: Nightmaiden & Swordtress Puppets
data.description: An old puppet crafted in the Eternal City.

data.name: Noble Sorcerer Ashes
data.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of a noble sorcerer. Spirit of a nobleman who once asked to be given a place at Raya Lucaria to learn glintstone sorceries. His talents were insufficient to be worthy of donning the stone crown, however, and he is only capable ofusing the most rudimentary sorcery.

data.name: Nomad Ashes
data.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of a nomad.

data.name: Omenkiller Rollo
data.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of Omenkiller Rollo.

data.name: Raya Lucaria Soldier Ashes
data.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of three Raya Lucaria soldiers.
data.effect: Summons three Raya Lucaria soldier spirits

data.name: Page Ashes
data.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of a page.

data.name: Skeletal Militiaman Ashes
data.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of two skeletal militiamen.

data.name: Spirit Jellyfish Ashes
data.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon a spirit jellyfish.

data.name: Skeletal Bandit Ashes
data.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirits of a skeletal bandit.

data.name: Stormhawk Deenh
data.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of Deenh the Stormhawk.

data.name: Twinsage Sorcerer Ashes
data.description: Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell. Use to summon the spirit of a Twinsage sorcerer.

data.name: Wandering Noble Ashes
